review.reviewBody: I wasn't sure about my size so I answered the questions they had and ordered the suggested size. Fit is perfect! Very warm and they feel great. Well made. Love them
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: I LOVE these. They're super cute and super comfy. Like a slipper boot. SADLY and REGRETFUL I had to send them back. I think because they're cut bigger - they kept sliding off my heels. I couldn't size down, I'm a 5 and that's the smallest they make. I have narrow and thin feet as well. I'm so sad. They feel true to size, just a bigger cut, makes them flop off my heels.
review.name: So cozy and so comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Soft, comfortable and .....cute. Look great with jeans.
review.name: I love the shoes

review.reviewBody: happy with the shoes, perfect birthday gift, super comfortable
review.name: love these shoes

review.reviewBody: I wear them everywhere casual. Very comfortable, easy to slip into them. I normally wear a 8.5 and purchased the 8, but it was too tight and returned them for a size 9 which fit perfectly! It seems like with Ugg now it's a luck of the draw whether to order an 8 or 9. I wish they had half sizes again. But other than that I definitely recommend because they are so comfortable, warm and cozy now that I have the size 9.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: I bought these online in black. 1st they are exceptionally comfortable, the quality is superb (just what you expect from Ugg. However, they are not as cute on as they are in a stand alone picture. I am keeping to wear them as very expensive yet super comfortable house slippers.
review.name: Really comfy but...

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes they're comfortable and looks great w my pants!
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes! They're comfortable and looks nice w my pants! Thanks Ugg for The dope shoes!
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: So comfortable and cute, you forget about the platform.
review.name: Fabulous

review.reviewBody: im a fun of UGG so any product they come out with is good!!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Chariot Brake Kit online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The top cable assembly did not fit on the metal handle. The diameter of the metal handle was too big or plastic pieces too small??? We could not match up the plastic parts, there was a 1/4 ingap. Instructions are useless. Don't buy.
review.name: Top assembly did not fit, Junk
comment:
Thank you for letting us know about the issues you encountered with your Thule Chariot Brake Kit. A representative has reached out to assist with troubleshooting the assembly to ensure a secure fit. 
We look forward to helping solve the problem and get your multisport trailer working as intended.

review.reviewBody: Just installed today and took it out on its first spin. Works just like it’s supposed too. Had to tighten/adjust the brakes a bit (as you will have to on all wire brake systems) and after adjustments, works perfectly!
review.name: Works great!

review.reviewBody:
I have used this on our lite 2 for several runs now and I must say that while most items from Thule are well made and work great this brake kit is really poor.  Assembly was pretty easy but the brake kit doesnt stop the stroller, itll slow it down on a hill which is really what I wanted it for but when you say brake kit you expect it to also provide a full stop.  The brake shoes doent apply pressure on the wheel evenly which is likely the cause of the poor brakeing pwerformance.  If you adjust the brake tight enough to actually stop the stroller it will rub and cause the stroller to slow down.  
The other issue and probably the bigger one that I have with this thing is that the handle just feels cheap.  When you twist it you can feel the stress on the pieces as they try to seperate from eah other.  I worry that if I tried to really apply enough pressure to bring the stroller to a stop the pieces would crak.  
Finally the action of the handle is not very smooth.  Thwere is not much spring action in the breaks like you would find in bike brakes which means you have to rotate the handle to apply the breaks but you also have to rotate it back to loosen them.  
Overall the kit does finction to slow you on a hill but for the cost the build quality and range of function fall far short of what I woudl expect from a Thule product.
review.name: Not great

review.reviewBody: The brake kit is garbage. It doesn’t even brake And lock like it suppose to.
review.name: Not worth it

name: Chariot Brake Kit

review.reviewBody:
I wasn't really sure about the corduroy finish on the Bright Orange, but I wanted a bright color  (and outside vents), so I decided to try it. I love it! I get positive comments from people in the lift line, from people I pass on the run, even from jaded lifties.

They're a little more snug through the hips than the TNF Freedom pants they replaced, but not too snug. Even though they're "not insulated" they are plenty warm, comparable to the TNF Freedom that have 'light' insulation. 

And now that we're into spring, they do a decent job of keeping me dry even though I'm sweaty.
review.name: Outstanding!

review.reviewBody: That?s it, not as dark great looking trousers, just a touch to purple. Color match is closer to the picture of pants w/o person wearing them
review.name: A touch too purple

review.reviewBody: I've worn these a half dozen times over the past month or two at the office and around the house. I haven't done any hiking or anything like that yet, but they're very comfortable and keep the bugs from biting my ankles at the park. I don't use the "cargo" pocket because it sits too much on the thigh for my liking, but again, I haven't done anything that requires another pocket. The location and angle of the front pocket openings feel a little awkward.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: The legs fit like normal pants but the waist is much larger than what it is labeled as
review.name: Good trousers but too large at the waist

review.reviewBody: Fabric pills up quickly on the inside. For a technical fabric, I've never had this issue happen on any other brand. Went to Rab website and they state its normal, and show you how to take care of the issue. A little mind boggling. How about make a technical fabric that doesn't require constant maintenance.
review.name: The fabric pills up fast

review.reviewBody: This is an awesome helmet, very comfortable with nice pads.
review.name: Very comfortable helmet!

review.reviewBody: After a recent crash, I was determined to buy the best helmet I could afford. After visiting the Virginia Tech site, I settled on the Trailblazer due to its 5 star rating. Unfortunately, it does not fit. Yes, I’ve got a large dome, but Smith helmets fit me extremely well with plenty of room for adjustment. With the Trailblazer, the helmet barely fit over my head, and this is with the adjustment knob cranked all the way open. I tried the slimmer pads that are included and got pretty much the same result. I know I’m not the only one with this issue because I noticed others made similar comments. If you’ve got a large skull or just a fat head, bear this in mind prior to purchase.
review.name: For Tiny Heads Only

review.reviewBody: I’m loving my new helmet.  The size seems right on.  It sits comfortably snug on my head and doesn’t require me to crank the retention system for it to feel secure and stable.  It is highly vented and the sweat pads do an absolutely amazing job of funneling any excess/dripping sweat to the sides of my face so sweat doesn’t drip into my glasses and interfere with my vision.  The front vents are set up great to allow sunglasses to sit in the helmet when you don’t want to wear them.  If you’re looking for a super comfortable, highly thought out and well designed helmet that looks sharp and offers amazing protection, this should be your top choice!
review.name: Your next helmet

review.reviewBody: This helmet sat like a crown atop my head. I
review.name: Smallest XL helmet I've tried on

name: Trailblazer Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody:
Love the idea and the execution of this belay biner. It's easy to engage and release the belay loop keeper and the screw gate has nice smooth action. 

Unfortunately it didn't do so well when my climber boinked and I'm guessing the biner was trending towards cross-loaded and the very small biner keeper gate sheared off, rendering the carabiner useless as there is now a sharp, broken metal edge at the narrow end of the carabiner. Bummer.
review.name: Great until it wasn't

name: Core Belay Locking Carbiner

review.reviewBody: Easy to install and fit perfect! Easy to follow instructions made installation a breeze.
review.name: Perfect fit!

review.reviewBody: This kit is specific to the Mitsubishi Outlander. It goes together with the Evo Flush rail and Foot Pack. The kit includes a torque wrench for torquing the bolts that fasten onto the car, and the wrench did not seem to work very well but I have my own torque wrench and used it to torque the bolts. The installation was easy and fast, and the roof rails appear to be working fine.
review.name: Works like a charm

review.reviewBody: 186033 is it a kit? is the kit 2 for one bar? is it 4 for complete system? Is it just one mount? frustrated trying to find cross rails, sorry, had to be said
review.name: website horrible

review.reviewBody: Very happy, ready for skis, boards, bikes and more!!
review.name: Fitment is perfect!

review.reviewBody: Thule engineering is detailed and it works they fit specified cars.
review.name: Thule - Kit 186044

review.reviewBody:
I read a lot of griping about the instructions. I found the instructions complete and very helpful. Between what came in the box for this kit, and the boxes for the other components, and the QR link to a site with more instructions and a video, this was an easy install. 

And, this thing is solid. Thule is not cheap... but it is well made.
review.name: Solid. Easy to put together.

review.reviewBody: I think this is a good product. However, the assembly instructions are not sufficient and hard to follow. Thankfully, YouTube saved the day.

review.reviewBody: When you need to be ready for anything and can afford a few extra ounces this is definitely the way to go. [And at 200 lbs an extra ounce or two is a silly worry!]
review.name: Solid, reliable poles

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, sturdy. and easy to adjust. The grips are quite comfortable as well.
review.name: TRekking Oles

review.reviewBody: Special gift for my (very active) son. He will love these poles.
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: These have been great for better stability hiking downward - joints are way more comfortable!
review.name: Stability

review.reviewBody: These have held up well, through the Grand Canyon, several ultra runs, and plenty of casual hikes. Comfortable and durable, what more can you ask for?
review.name: These work great

review.reviewBody: These poles helped me into the crater of Mt. St. Helen's. They are tough and durable. I'll have to replace the mud baskets due to the harsh terrain but other than that they did an awesome job.
review.name: Tough and durable

review.reviewBody:
I've used these poles for 3 mountains so far:
-Pichincha Integral: 12 km treck at avg 4500 meters
-Imbabura: 7km treck with +1500 meters elevation change
-Iliniza Norte: summit at 5100 meters

So far, great. they are light, easy to pack and stow.
They feel sturdy and well constructed. Tip seems durable
review.name: Light and sturdy

review.reviewBody: These trekking poles are lightweight and durable. The quick lock adjustments ensure that they stay locked in place even over the roughest terrain, mile after mile…
review.name: Great Poles!

review.reviewBody: I'm a huge fan of these trekking poles! I purchased them for a multi-day trek on the Alta Via Uno in the Dolomites and hiked across all types of terrain, from dirt to rock to creek to snow, and these poles provided great stability. Plus, they are solidly built so no "pinging" sounds as you pole plant, which I really appreciate!
review.name: I'm a huge fan of

review.reviewBody: Nicely weighted and compact. Rides on my backpack easily and available when I need them for the downhills.
review.name: Perfect weight

review.reviewBody: I've been riding the Continental 5000's and 4000's.  New purchase change due to how hard it is to install a Continental tubeless 5000.  The ride is much smoother and so is the handling.  Wasn't looking to change but the installation on the Continental was nearly impossible.
review.name: Big Fan

review.reviewBody: I've put a couple hundred sporadic miles on these before I put them through a long, continuous haul in a 630 mile race in MN. The terrain was quite mixed. Trails had a lot of bumps and cracks and there were many miles of nasty pavement. These tires aren't supple or very comfy but they did the job well running them tubeless. It is important to note that the pressure recommendations vary between tubeless and tubed configurations. On the sidewall for mine says, "Min. 72 psi - Max 101 psi with Inner tube. Min. 58 psi - Max 87 psi tubeless. I ran 28c on Hunt Aero Wide 34's. The inner rim width is 20 mm. The overall tire width on this combo comes to 30 mm. I had no issues with the bead seating or sealant leakage. Psi was 74 on both tires for the race. They rolled, cornered and brake nice in dry and when I was caught in a thunder storm, they did not disappoint. These rolled and turned with no loss in confidence. I did, however suffer an inescapable puncture at mile 220 in the middle of the night and in the rain. I hit a small, sharp rock on a descent and buy the sound of it I knew it was bad. I had a nice 7 mm slice on the sidewall along with a dinged rim. I threw in an Aerothan tube, booted it with a $1 bill, the bead seated, inflated to 60 psi and it held pressure & integrity for 410 more miles. I am, indeed a fan of these tires. I will continue to run these on my work commutes, city rides and long distance road adventures.
review.name: Goodbye Gatorskins

review.reviewBody: Excellent tire, Tubeless setup and easy install on my Campagnolo WTO wheels. Great handling tire and very puncture resistant due to the kevlar belt. A little heavier than some but works great for a training tire and so far holding up on my glass/debris covered roads.
review.name: Big fan of Cinturato's

name: Cinturato Velo Tubeless Ready Tire

review.reviewBody: Awesome little product. Works great even though backcountry boxes their products like crap and it bounced all around the big empty box the whole trip here LOL 😆
review.name: Works perfect!

review.reviewBody: I have really cold feet and have tried everything and these work better than any other brand that I have tried.  Women's size 8.5 cycling shoe and ordered a medium. My ankles are on the small side - they are a sung fit on the ankles but this probably contributes to their success.  Order up a size if you have a medium build.
review.name: best and warmest shoe covers

review.reviewBody:
Bought at a competitor, but they don't offer reviews for this product and y'all might need help with sizing since I struggled to find a review. 

These are tight in the ankle, as in pull them up and together then hope to pull the zipper up all the way tight. Also, it's strange to me to zip on the outside of the ankle when women's shoes tend to zip on the inner ankle. 

I wear a 38 and bought a large. Glad I did. It's a bit loose on a one BOA shoe, but the three velcro shoes it's tighter. Enough room to add a hot hands pack between the shoe and the cover, but not too tight to where you can't even get the cover over the shoe. Medium probably would fit, but it would be tight. I went to Castelli's site to find the correct size chart.

Haven't worn on a ride because it's record highs summer still.
review.name: tight on ankle

review.reviewBody: These covers are well made and warm.  I live in Minnesota and have been riding up to 30 miles in 20 degree temps with only a minimal amount of chill in my toes. My shoe size is 6.5. The small fits like a glove however, you would have to have the ankles of a 10 year old boy in order to zip them up. The medium still fit ok around the shoe and are still tight in the ankle but with effort can be zipped. I am 5'5' 106lbs and do not suffer from any cardiac anomalies that might cause me to retain water in my lower extremities. (ie: no "cankles" here...smile) Otherwise, love these covers!! But, buy the bigger size.
review.name: Warm but runs small in the ankle

name: Dinamica Shoe Cover - Women's

review.reviewBody: I’ll admit I was skeptical about this purchase, but boy am I did it. This is an awesome lightweight, temperature regulating hoody that thrives as an active piece and casual layer. It’s not like a traditional hoody in terms of thickness, this thing is super breathable and performs best with a base layer under it. The sizing is wonderful, which is something I can’t always say about Patagonia clothing! Perfect length in the size large, and the sleeves are loose enough for movement and layering underneath. Overall this was a brilliant design by Patagonia, I wear this hoody almost daily. If you’re still unsure about buying because of the other reviews on this site, I encourage you to check out the reviews on Patagonia’s website. The consensus is that this hoody rocks!
review.name: Fantastic Piece, don’t listen!

review.reviewBody: Grid Fleece Hoodies are quite a sought-after garment category these days; but this one lacks the feature that's De Rigueur for the top of the line: A shock cord and cord-lock for the hood. In the lane of these tops that don't have adjustable hoods, the OR Grid Fleece has a better baclava/hood design; and in the lane WITH adjustments, the Mountain Hardwear Grid Fleece 1/4 zip is the best that's readily available everywhere except Leadville, CO. These two mentioned alternatives are materially less expensive than this Patagucci. I already have the OR and MH garments; think I'll wait until this one gets a shock cord in the hood, and maybe presents in less muted colorways.
review.name: Wait Until Next Year

review.reviewBody: Large and baggy for a medium.
review.name: Poor fit

review.reviewBody:
When I first saw this hoodie launched mid-fall, I knew I had to have it. But, I held back as the lack of reviews and price was off-putting. So when the sale hit after the holidays, I scooped one up. Sadly, the fit is poor and the weight of the hoodie itself is disappointing. I'm 6'2", 180lbs and have a lanky frame. I fall right in between M and L with Patagonia, usually going with a M for the fit in the torso and dealing with shorter-than-desirable arms. I opted for the L in this, based on the advice from a rep. After trying it on, a M would have definitely been too short in both the torso and the arms. However, the body of this hoodie gave me a pear-shaped look, and the bottom hem seems very stretched. I think the extra fabric for the pouch also makes the front look "frumpy". To top it off, the garment had an odd smell -- not quite a factory smell, but something more vegetal. Weird! 

I was really disappointed as I like the color and concept of the hoodie, but I couldn't get past the awkward fit. For $50 I would keep it for around the house and spring/fall hikes, but for twice that, it's gotta go back.
review.name: a rare Patagonia fail

name: Capilene Thermal Hoodie - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Eldo LTH GV Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This shoe was everything I wanted in an alpine shoe but alas, it was not to be. I usually order a half size up for thick socks but this shoe runs large so I ordered my regular size. They fit perfectly but a terrible run on the top of my foot that would have been a hot spot. The tongue has way too much extra fabric in it and so you have almost a ruche effect. Even if my foot was extra wide I think there is too much fabric. Gorgeous shoe, poor engineering. Returned.
review.name: Poorly designed tongue

name: Eldo LTH GV Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Absolutely LOVE these shoes. So much so that I bought a second pair to put away so I will have them for at least another couple of years. It seems like every time I find a shoe that works for my feet they always get discontinued… I’m not taking any chances with these, lol!! I may even buy a third pair if they continue to be made for another few months.
review.name: Bought a 2nd pair!!

review.reviewBody: Fits well right away, break in is easy. Keen products are durable. This one is another winner
review.name: Another winner

review.reviewBody: Was wary on these and not sure about the toe box width since I prefer a wider toe box for splaying while walking. Have enjoyed these Keens more than I thought and REALLY appreciate the shoe strings that stay snug.
review.name: Comfortable utility

review.reviewBody: About 15 years ago, GoLite,a now defunct outdoor clothing company, made the Lime Lite. I had 3-4 colors of this shoe. Several of those colors are now available in the Jasper Suede line. The Lime Lites had a padded tongue, not so the Jasper. I still have the Lime Lite in red. The Jasper is a decent shoe. Fit well right out of the box though the sole is not quite as supportive as I would have liked, nor are they as rugged. The Jasper has a funky lace up placement. I think it detracts from the look. I wound up re-lacing them abandoning the bottom most eyelets. The Jasper is true to size and the color offerings are unique which is what attracted me to the GoLites all those years ago. Overall I’d say the Jasper is acceptable.
review.name: Decent Knockoff

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like that they fit well and they feel great for walking
review.name: Comfy shoes

review.reviewBody: Very spacious without being oversized. This is my first wide toebox shoe and it did feel a bit too large at first. However, after putting on other sneakers, I felt my toes constrict in the sneaker and craved the extra space. The Jasper Suede has become my new favorite, casual shoe. The cushioning is incredibly comfortable as well and paired with the wide toebox, the comfort is unmatched. I've also received many compliments. I guess it helps that I work at a climbing gym. 5 stars
review.name: Best casual shoe with climbing DNA

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice looking shoe. Runs a little small. I'm size 10 with a normal too slightly wide foot. The Keen size 10 was both a bit short and narrow. I'll need to return for a size 10.5
review.name: Nice looking shoe. Runs a

review.reviewBody: Love the look and feel of the shoe. Disappointed the sizing did not work for me. I am a true size 12. The shoe size 12 was too small and the size 13 was too big!
review.name: Runs Small

review.reviewBody: Needed a wider than usual toe box for a broken foot. These fit the bill and are comfortable enough to make getting around tolerable. Very pleased with my purchase!
review.name: For my husband

review.reviewBody:
The Jasper shoe description included two sets of laces, and this was shown in the pictures for every color but Mink. I asked via the chat if the Mink color came with a second set of laces and was told sorry, no. I almost didn’t buy the shoe, but decided I could buy other laces.(Not a fan of the “look at me look at me” red laces).
When the shoes arrived, there was a second set of laces (nicely colored to match the shoe) after all. 
Five stars for the shoes, minus one for poor information from Keen.
review.name: Shoes good despite site and chat misinformation

name: Jasper Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I purchased these for my daughter as an early Christmas present. I ordered the next larger size than what she wears because it said in the description they run small. She really likes them and they are a bit roomy but she said she prefers that so she can wear heavy socks with them if need be. She said they reminder her of snowboarding boots.
review.name: Roomy winter boot

review.reviewBody: I loved the style when I saw the picture online. When I received the boots ( I excitedly order 3 pair for myself and 2 daughters when they went on sale) I tried mine on and found them very heavy. The insulation is very thick, and I’m sure warm, but this made the actual calf opening quite narrow when compared to the circumference of the outer shell. Sadly, returned.
review.name: Wanted to like, but very heavy boot

review.reviewBody: I always get one size bigger from my normal shoe size when buying snow boots. They were way too small. When I called to get the next bigger size they were out of them and weren?t getting them back in stock??. Loved the boot just not the sizing & availability. Hope this helps someone else when ordering.
review.name: Sizing is way too small!

review.reviewBody: This is suppose to be waterproof. Well I couldn't understand why my feet was always so cold.. I bought heated socks nothing worked. -0° they say. Well today my feet was freezing which meant I couldn't get warm all day.  I spent money on a 3rd pair Of Kamik boots hoping for a different result. I just want to make it through a full Colorado winter without having to buy a new pair of boots. No cold wet feet while I'm driving the bus. Dry warm feet. All winter long. Tired of wasting money. Does anyone have any suggestions... This brand isn't it for me. 3 pairs wasted. And they run smaller.
review.name: Hate this & brand waste money 3rd pair.

review.reviewBody: No complaints about the boot. Returned because they are very similar in amount of insulation to the boots my wife currently has, and her feet are constantly cold when we are ice fishing. Decided to look for a boot with better cold temp rating. So far the return process has been a breeze.
review.name: Kamick Greenbay 4

review.reviewBody:
My wife is undoubtedly my better half, but she's also not particularly outdoorsy. My kiddos follow after me in that they enjoy doing outdoor activities so my poor wife tends to be drug along quite often. Ensuring she is as happy and comfortable as possible is paramount to having a good day and these boots took us forward lightyears in snow comfort.

Happy wife, happy life. Warm, dry, and comfortable feet keep me from getting beat.
review.name: Happy Wife...

name: Greenbay 4 Boot - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Nathan Run Sling 6L Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect size for essential when walking around. Fits a light jacket and some snacks. The small zippered pocket is a great place for IDs and passport. The 25oz soft flask is about right for a few hours for of sightseeing.
review.name: Nice walk around pack

review.reviewBody: I’m in love with this bag so easy open and good pocket storage this is my daily bag to carry for my day to day life!
review.name: Best sling

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have always been skeptical about running packs, but have realized access to hydration ensures my own safety, so i thought what the hell. The 6L is just the right size for most all my adventures. I was worried about feeling like a pinata, but everything was secure and it felt super light. Love having compartments to keep my pockets clear and free!! Cool color, would definitely recommend
review.name: Surprised and Impressed!!!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just what I'd been looking for to replace my waist pack!  Quick access to water without having to worry about my keys, etc. falling out. Comfortable weight distribution and I love the color.
review.name: Perfect for hiking!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My running experience mirrors my daily life. I need to be prepared for variable conditions but not bogged down. The limitless sling is as simple as it is utilitarian and lets me pack my essentials. I can run comfortably with an extra layer, a journal if I want to stop and smell the roses, and most importantly snacks. But the size keeps me mindful of what is important to have with me, and what is excess. Perfect for those longer runs far from resources, and also just running around town when you need a little extra carrying capacity.
review.name: Everything I Need, Nothing of What I Don't

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Seems like it will be great to take on hikes and bikes! So helpful to have the HydroPak in a smaller pack that you can sling over your shoulder.
review.name: Cute and functional!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been looking for a sling that fits comfortably and is versatile for all my favorite outdoor activities. I most definitely found it with the limitless 6 liter sling, this is exactly what any outdoor lover needs! Whether it was my phone and nutrition bars while running or tool set while biking, this sling holds all my essential trip items! I just took it on my trail run and  it was very light and I was able to adjust the straps comfortably enough where it did not bounce while running. I was excited to use the water bladder portion on the bag as I typically do not like holding water bottles in my hands while working out. That feature was a game changer so I can do longer hikes/runs. Overall 10/10!!
review.name: Best Active Outdoor Sling

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this Sling's buckle-centric design, a pretty unique feature among similar products. Nice and minimal for quick outings and day hikes. Tough construction for years of use.
review.name: Buckle Up!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the first time I've tried a sling and I'm super impressed. It's lightweight, spacious, and the torso strap really does keep the sling perfectly in place and prevent any bouncing. I love the side zipper that allows easy access to the larger main compartment too.
review.name: Light, comfortable, no-bounce

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just got this sling and I absolutely LOVE it! It is incredibly comfortable, great quality, so easy to pack and use, lightweight, and has so much storage capacity for its 6L size! Perfect for the everyday run and longer adventures!
review.name: Most comfortable sling!

name: Run Sling 6L Hydration Pack

review.reviewBody: Easy to slip on and off. They might be a little excessive for where I am, but they work very nicely and keep my feet warm.
review.name: Very warm

review.reviewBody:
I usually where a 10.5. I purchased ann 11 and they are too small with a regular sock. I am ordering another pair size 13 to accomodate regular sock and a thicker one over the top.  
Unfortuanetly I am unable to return them to Back Country becuase the box and tags were tossed so th =e 11's will become guest boots.

I only tried them on. Never worn out.  Stayine with them because a friend has them and likes them very much.
review.name: Baffin Wolf Winter Boot

review.reviewBody: This boot is so well made it will last a lifetime! The tread is perfect for our sometimes icy driveway in Colorado, and the inner boot lining is warm and durable. Be sure to order 1 to 2 sizes up, however, as the lining makes it too snug to go with your normal sizes. Great product!
review.name: Lifetime Boot!

review.reviewBody:
Pros: really grippy soles, even on ice; easy on/off; tall sides are great for deep snow; easy on/off is convenient; comfortable and not too heavy.

Cons: these are warm but if temp is really low or you're out in the elements for a long time and not active, I've needed to supplement with toe warmers. Not a big deal and I suppose the upside is my feet haven't over heated unless it's pretty warm.

I usually wear 11-12 depending on the brand, but sized up to 13 based on other reviews and it was a good call. At first I thought 13 might be too small but once I got used to getting these on/off with the tall sides it felt just right.

I'd buy again. My 9 year old son has a similar Baffin pair of boots and loves them and they keep his feet warm in all sorts of weather in Central and Northern Wisconsin.
review.name: Best winter boot I've had in a long time

name: Wolf Winter Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Love the fit, it’s like a glove. Comfortable and stretchy. Very easy to wear and surf in. Nice and warm too!
review.name: Buttery smooth and stretchy

review.reviewBody: I just used this suit for the first time last week at Lake Tahoe in 65 degree water, and it was super comfortable, warm, stretchy, and I barely noticed I had it on while cruising around in the boat before/after being in the water. I purchased a few other suits to try on, and I would say in comparison, this one felt exceptionally soft and stretchy (for comparison, the others were the same thickness, 3/2). I am 5'11, about 163lbs, with athletic legs and a curvier bottom/hips. It was so easy to put this suit on, and honestly most of them feel so tight going on over the hips that I either give up or feel full of anxiety wearing them. This one was super easy to put on/off, and feels nice and secure at the neck without tugging or choking at all. I also have a long torso, so finding a suit with a little more length was really hard, but this one fits perfect! I love the raw edges of the fabric at the wrists and ankles, so there is zero pinching. Also, in comparison to some other suits, this one has a longer back zipper, so you can unzip it pretty far down your lower back. This makes it a breeze to change into, unlike some others where the back zipper is so short that your basically climbing into it from a slightly enlarged neck hole. I love the durable reinforced fabric at the knees, which is also very stretchy. I can't wait to use this suit more for all kinds of things! Compared to the rental suit my husband used, this one felt so much nicer, softer, and more conforming to a body. I think it would do justice to any woman with some shape, curves, or muscularity. It is easy and natural feeling to move around in, and the cheerful tropical print on the underarms is really fun and happy. It does not have one of those neck "bib" things that comes around from the back, over one's head, and then tucked in at the front, but I have a feeling I wouldn't need that. The neck seal was plenty adequate all on it's own. Don't hesitate to buy this suit--it's an excellent value for the money, SO cute, and makes you feel like a toasty seal exploring chilly water without a care in the world for the cold temps. 100% would buy again.
review.name: Amazing fit, super comfortable, stretchy

review.reviewBody: I bought this about a month ago and so happy I did. This wetsuit fit well and did the job. I always get cold when I snorkel even in Belize. This suit kept me warm and was comfortable to wear. Happy with my purchase. I’m about 5’7” and 145#
review.name: Fit well

review.reviewBody: I bought this for the Southern California Fall when it's not cold enough for a 4/3 but a little too chilly for a Spring suit (if you're a SoCal weather wimp like me). It is perfect. Soft and stretchy and just warm enough. It fits me very well. I love the key pocket on the leg and the print on the arms and torso makes me smile! I was so tired of boring black and the navy/print combo does the trick!
review.name: Perfect Fall Suit

name: Bahia 3/2mm Full Wetsuit - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Bangtail Mid Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots before moving to Colorado last summer. I love them! Oboz is one of those brands that fit my feet, so for me, they were great out of the box. I was able to go on a steep, multi-hour hike without so much as a rub on my first wear. They are super light and super warm. Now that I'm in Colorado, they're my go-to on snowy days and will be my hiking boot anytime it's chilly outside.
review.name: Great Boot!

review.itemreviewed: Bangtail Mid Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: My go-to snow boot and hike boot for the cold months. This boot is so light considering it's insulated! That arctic grip is no joke. I have had no issues trekking through snow, slush, and ice!
review.name: Love This Boot!!!

name: Bangtail Mid Insulated B-DRY Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I loved the look and feel of this shoe. It's extremely light, has great heal capture, the sole felt stiff and solid, and BOA is high quality.  I really wanted to keep them, but after trying the on and thinking about it, being realistic, they are too tight in the ball of the foot area for me. I am returning them. I just placed a new order for the Lake CX238 Wide. I must have the wide, cannot manage a normal width shoe.
review.name: Beautiful Shoe - But too narrow for me

review.reviewBody: Logged 2500 miles and just love these shoes. Comfortable, light, stylish. Seriously considering buying a few for future proofing myself in case they update or discontinue.
review.name: Tempted to stockpile

review.reviewBody:
Absolutely love the uppers on these shoes. Absolutely hate the soles!
I love the look and feel of the uppers they were super comfortable when I first tried them on and the double boa is my favorite type of anchor system&.. BUT
Once I made the mistake of putting my cleats on them and setting out for my first ride I realized that the "carbon composite" sole is complete trash. There's no way you can put the power through to the pedals. These things are floppy like an old wet pair of gym shoes. I've never felt such pain in my feet as I did trying to climb in them:( 
Medieval torture device at best. It really is a shame because they are beautiful and ultra comfortable as long as you're not cycling in them.
review.name: Beautiful and painful !!

review.reviewBody: After about three months of use, one of the BOA dials broke off completely as I was attempting to loosen it to remove it. Although I think the fit is good and it is a good looking shoe, I am disappointed in quality.
review.name: BOA dial broke off

review.reviewBody: I was looking for an under $300 shoe and this one is great!. Fits comfortable. Slightly tight around the toe and I did return for a .5 size change up that now fits great.
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody:
I've had bad luck getting cycling shoes to fit right.   Shoes might feel good in the store, but feeling hot spots on long rides.   I have normal width feet, but high arches.  Given this I stick to what I know works.

Overall the Regime shoes fit great and is extremely comfortable.   My old Trans road shoes came with different arch support fit kits.  the Regime only comes with a standard insole.   To my surprise, my old soles (43) fit into the new Regime (size 43.5) making its fit just that little much better.   I guess the fit kits come in increments of 4 half sizes (e.g., 43-44.5).   If you need different arch support other than medium, get one of the Super Natural fit kits.  Its worth it.

I love the Boa system with very fine tightening adjustments.  You can't reverse the Boa dial, but when you release the dial, it doesn't fully release.  It opens up just a little allowing you to release just a little pressure and click it in quickly as readjust as needed (maybe just a click or two to snug it up again).
review.name: Comfortable shoes

name: Regime Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Incredibly lightweight PFD that didn't skimp on features. This is my new favorite packrafting PFD!
review.name: Best packrafting PFD

review.reviewBody:
I love the fit of the lifejacket. Would recommend to others! I am using it for sailing, power boat driving, and dinghy sailing. Stands out a bit compared to the extremely common Zhik vests, so I like the uniqueness. The tan color is also super cool looking and can work with other colors of clothing well, but stands out (and slightly more visible safety wise) more than just a standard black vest. 

I got the M/L and I am 5’11” ~155lbs and 31” waist Male. Could have maybe done the S/M, but it would have looked quite small. I do cinch down the side straps nearly all the way. 

Pockets are awesome, especially the phone pocket. I only have 2 gripes:
1. With the phone pocket the foam doesn’t have a cut out for the rough outline of the phone so if you have one in there, it presses out a phones width into your chest which isn’t ideal, but not THAT noticeable.
2. I use a radio occasionally with the vest and there isn’t a way to clip one on there. (Niche issue) I could have gotten a vest with more utility. Could probably add a cloth loop onto the knife holder to achieve this if it was a big deal for me. 

Have capsized dinghy sailing a few times with it already and it has done a great job keep me up!
review.name: Great fit. Very stylish

review.reviewBody: I bought this mostly for use with my sup. Easy to get on, doesn’t slide up in the water, and doesn’t restrict a single bit of movement. A couple PFD’s I’ve used were hard to get back on the board with, too bulky on the chest and would catch on the board. Hasn’t happened once with this PFD. The embroidered mandala on the back is also such a sick little piece on the PFD. Highly recommend this PFD
review.name: Comfortable and Classy

review.reviewBody: There’s a place for everything. The zip pockets are perfect for sunblock and small bits, the cell phone pocket along the chest fits my iPhone securely, and I have quick knife access. Super comfortable to wear and move in as well. A well designed product!
review.name: Thoughtful design

review.reviewBody: Super light. Low profile. Comfortable. Easy on. Easy off. I’ve worked commercially on whitewater for 31 seasons from Maine to California to Alaska to Chile to India to New Zealand etc. I’ve taught over 400 swiftwater rescue courses. I’ve used a lot of PFDs. This is my favorite. I love the Astral Green Jacket but it isn’t necessary for many river running endeavors. It’s heavy, bulky, and complex to put on and off. I will always own a green jacket and I will always reach for my YTV as often as I can. Towing boats is not something I advocate for  very much with a few exceptions. Tethered rescue swims are cool and fun and really never utilized with some rare exceptions. Light n fast is safe. The YTV helps meet this need. Yeah there is no clamshell pocket up front but I don’t need a lunch box full of snacks in my person. I don’t need pulleys in my PFD and neither do you. It just feels cool. Shaving 10 lbs off my upper body is worth it. The YTV is where it’s at.
review.name: Favorite PFD in 30+ years running whitewater

review.reviewBody: Wonderful PFD for raft guiding on the New Mexico Rio Grande! Light weight, flat front for easy self rescue, and plenty of space for the booby gals. Only fits a smaller knife in the pockets, but plenty of space in the hidden inside pocket. Would have been fine with a small/medium but I got a medium/large and it does the trick!
review.name: Wonderful PFD for raft guide women

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing a YTV for SUP and casual paddling since they were first released. Love the huge range of motion it provides and its lightweight feel, but the pockets sucked.  With the YTV 2.0 I get all the same benefits of the original, but vibrant colors and the new center pocket it's awesome.  Now I can fit all the things... Phone, snacks, and sunscreen.
review.name: Even better with new pocket

review.reviewBody:
This PFD is light weight and less cumbersome than traditional PFD’S. Easy on and off
good pockets. Comfortable
review.name: Love my new YTV 2.0

review.reviewBody: The YTV 2.0 fits me well.  As a large breasted female, well fitting PFDs are hard to find.  The low volume front allows for easier self rescues.   The comfort of the YTV 2.0 allows me to wear it all day on the water.
review.name: YTV 2.0 is comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Preparing to guide paddle boarding trips this summer, I am stoked to have upgraded my PFD to the Astral YTV 2.0. Despite snowy conditions, I was able to get a good amount of time testing the PFD, despite the snow, and it turns out that it is surprisingly warm, showcasing its insulation properties perfect for cold Rocky Mountain waters. Its intuitive design and snug fit impressed me, offering comfort and mobility crucial for guiding. The expanded pockets and recycled shell further enhance its appeal. Overall, I believe that the Astral YTV 2.0 is an excellent choice for avid water sport enthusiasts seeking both comfort and performance in their gear.
review.name: A great upgrade to your water gear!

name: YTV 2.0 Personal Flotation Device

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love the vibrant colors on these shoes. I had to switch out the laces to Lock Laces so they stay tight all day and can't come untied. I am a professional caddie so I'm walking in dew most mornings and these shoes keep most of the moisture out.
review.name: A good shoe

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Got these for my trip to Ireland and they were awesome. They're snugger in the toe area than my Bondis (more like my Clifton's) and I feared discomfort but it wasn't there. Solid on loose rocky terrain. Repelled what little water I encountered. Comfortable all day long. A traveler from the States wearing Bondis asked me about them on the streets of Dingle and I gave him the thumbs up.
review.name: Just super

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: First time Hoka buyer of this model in Men's and one for Woman's for my girlfriend. I've worn New Balance for 20+ years and my GF has worn Brooks for 10+ years. We decided to try this model on to see what the hype was all about. Initially, we loved them instantly! I occasionally wear them to work in a medical setting and my GF wore it daily while bartending. We both liked the fit, color we chose, being Goretex and being comfortable. After 10 months, my Challenger 7 GTX started to tear on top of the shoe, in the crease where I flex my toes. Her's started to do the same in 5 months plus her treaded soles started to come apart!! We haven't even worn them in a rugged trail. It's upsetting because we hoped it would last longer. I reached out to Customer support and we are returning them for a refund and and exchange for my GF. Crossing our fingers that her exchange of the same shoe will be a better experience. The did not have mine in stock anymore. This review would not allow me to post any photos I took to show you how they aren't holding up as they should. I really liked the pair I had too.
review.name: Challenger 7 GTX seems to be Challenged.

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I used it for every day thing they just completely good
review.name: Love it they are really comfy and soft

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fit right out of the box. A few outings in wet weather and no wet feet!
review.name: Completely waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this bc was under impression it would fit 14EE, it does not come in wide. stay away.
review.name: if you have EE feet stay away

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use these for both hiking and running. They give good damping and feel very comfortable.
review.name: Great trailshoe

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I will say I loved the shoe. But the treads were bare and coming off shortly after getting them. I will also say that they were exchanged for a new pair and have a great policy for returns if you have issues. As we all know, companies can sometimes change that policy andwhere would I be if that happened. 180 down the drain if that happens.
review.name: Great shoe.... but does not last.

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These developed creases on top after a few days. After 6 months holes started to develop at the edge of the crease. They are no longer waterproof.
review.name: Holes on the tops after less tha 7 months

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Sneekers squeek especially when walking on hard surfaces. Very disappointed. How can this be fixed because I don't want to wear them?
review.name: Sneekers squeek

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn countless pairs of La Sportiva approach shoes over the decades and loved them all. These gave me the worst blisters I’ve ever had, and scrunched my toes together in an excruciating way. The pain was so bad on a descent that I actually switched to climbing shoes — on scree! And they don’t even climb well. Huge miss for La Sportiva, I am switching brands ‘til they build a good approach shoe again.
review.name: Painful, bad fit, poor climbing

review.reviewBody:
This is my second pair.
Comfortable.  A sole/foot bed that strikes the perfect balance between flexibility and support.  I highly recommend this and the Scarpa Zen Pro
review.name: Rock Solid Performer - Daily use

review.reviewBody:
Trying these on, I quickly realized they were narrow, so I upped by 1/2 size and that worked fine.  I actually like the narrow front, since my favorite LaSportiva Climbing Shoe is the Solution.  If they fit you, these shoes are very supportive.  For some strange reason, they  make certain of my socks descend into the shoe under the heel.  Anklets with rolled backs don't suffer this phenomenon.
Finally, they utterly look like clown shoes with their bright red laces, so I replaced those laces with all black.  Geez, the laces are LONG = you have to go over 6 feet.  I used a 10 penny nail to widen the lace holes so the laces would shift better whilst moving.
review.name: Narrow!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are well built and the little I was able to wear them they performed well on the trail. But from the get-go the formed toe box was very tight and I have a narrow foot. By day 2, my little toes on both feet were blistering and I had to tape them. With the ridged toe box design there is absolutely no way they would “Break In” to alleviate the pressure.  So these are going up for donation, an I am out the cost with less than 10 miles on the shoes.
review.name: Too Narrow of a Toe Box

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love these shoes. They seemed like exactly what I needed, but after giving it a few tries I had to sell them because the shape of the shoe is oddly narrow towards the front. Even with the laces adjusted to reduce tightness, the foot just doesn't feel right in the shoe. I've met others with similar experiences with this shoe so it's not just me. Of course there are some people who with narrow feet for whom this will fit nicely. I'm jealous of those people, the shoe is well built and seems like it would do its job very well, if only I could actually wear it
review.name: Weird foot shape

review.reviewBody:
The other reviewers are confusing the length of a shoe with how wide a shoe is. I sized a half size up to match the reviews and found my toes far back from the front and a loose heel. The length is the exact same as all La Sportiva shoes.

Unfortunately, these are the most narrow La Sportiva shoes I've ever seen. They fit more like an Arcteryx shoe. You can size up, but what good are approach shoes when your toes are way far back from the front? I'm going to try a couple more sizes, but my expectation is that despite amazing specs and construction, these shoes won't fit most La Sportiva fans correctly.
review.name: Not La Sportiva Fit

review.reviewBody:
I got a pair of these and, I'm impressed in some ways but not in others. 

The good:
The rubber is super nice.  Very grippy and it really lets you move over rough terrain with ease.  Plus, holds up super well.  
Shoes are very comfortable.
The outers are durable.  

The Bad:
The inners.  The inside ankle of my shoe started coming apart within.... two weeks.  I've put a decent amount of miles on these shoes already and now more of the inner of the shoe is tearing apart.  They still feel fine and perform well but, the fact that they're literally coming apart at the seams on the inside is disheartening.  

I've been a fan of LaSpo for a while now and honestly this is the first time I've ever been let down by  one of their products.  I haven't been exceptionally rough on my shoes, they've just been used for what they're designed to do.  It just sucks seeing them come apart on the inside so quickly because I actually really like them otherwise.

Overall, it could be a good shoe but, the quality issues are definitely glaring.  I'd probably go with the TX4's next time.
review.name: Not so great?

review.reviewBody: I wanted something burlier to replace my TX4s after they started to fall apart prematurely so I picked these up. They are awesome shoes: they're light, supportive enough for backpacking with a 40 lb pack, and I can climb low class 5 in them no problem. The only caveat is sizing.  Sizing is quite a bit different from the TX4s. My size 45 (11.5 US) TX4s fit me like a dream but these run small and have a much narrower toe box and run small. After a miserable time climbing Mt. Shasta in a size 45 that I bought without trying on I bumped up to a 45.5 and am quite happy with them. I'd recommend going up a half size to a full size depending on how wide your feet are.
review.name: Love 'em

review.reviewBody:
I?m not one to write reviews, but these shoes are above and beyond in my opinion. I?ve been using these in the Oregon and Washington mountains and find them to be a perfect fit for when I need a do-it-all shoe. Light and breathable with a technical fit, but also stiff enough to make crossing boulder fields and climbing a breeze. I?ve paired these with a stiffer strap on crampon and found them excellent for moderate summer glacier ascents. I switched to these from my TX4?s as I was looking for something a bit lighter that I could move a bit quicker in. I wouldn?t say I can ?run? in these but I most certainly can get moving on the way down with much more comfort than before. I find I?m much quicker on low 5th rock in these as well with the climbing shoe like feel. However I they don?t climb cracks near as well as the TX4s did. I have not climbed above 5.6 in these shoes and that feels about as far as I?d feel comfortable in them without actual rock shoes.

The only downside I?ve found as a wide footed individual these run a bit slim and short, but it is supposed to be a more technical fit I guess. I had to order 1/2 size up to get the correct fit.
review.name: Fast and light approach shoe

review.reviewBody: These appear to be the same great quality you expect from La Sportiva, however they are labeling the sizes quite small. I returned mine for TWO sizes larger. Size up at least 1-2 sizes.
review.name: Real small
comment: What size street shoes do you wear, like chacos or birks or something?

review.reviewBody: After my first day with this helmet, it was my favorite. Great fit, best strap system ever, and orange is extremely high visibility.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: Awesome looking helmet. Unfortunately with my taller head  it sat super high and looked like I had an alien head 😂. Luckily I was able to return it without issue.
review.name: Not for big heads.

review.reviewBody:
Sizing: I used the POC sizing guide, I measured towards the max end of the medium, went with the medium fits grate, I still have for a skull cap when the weather get chilly.
The chin strap is easy to adjust.
review.name: Almost don’t realize I’m wearing a helm!

review.reviewBody: So happy to buy this helmet. fits and looks well.
review.name: Nice helmet with great features

review.reviewBody: I've now done about a half dozen rides in this lid. Very light feeling and was basically as easy a possible to put on and go. I've noticed that the chin strap seems to loosen on its own volition from time to time. The rest of the retention system feels very secure. I typically wear a skull cap or standard, brimmed cycling cap under my helmet.  For the most part, I've not had any issues but there a couple cap / sunglass combinations wherein I've felt like everything is being smooshed. Not a big deal when I consider the ripping deal I got on this lid.
review.name: Lightweight and super air flow

review.reviewBody: Really liking the helmet so far, ordered a small on the 50% off deal, when it came it was too small so when I went to switch it out they only had the “2023” models in medium that where back at $200 so I ended up ordering the “2023” helmet that looks the exact same and I can’t find a single difference. Helmet came all dusty. Still a nice helmet! Best one I’ve owned yet!
review.name: Nice helmet!

review.reviewBody: I know POC has a good reputation for making quallity products but honestly I wanted this helmet for it's looks. What I didn't know is that the ventilation is outstanding, I was pleasantly surprised to feel the air flowing through and keeping you cool, so good looking and cool on hot summer days, very happy with my new helmet!
review.name: Cool Helemt

review.reviewBody:
I wonder who runs Marmot nowadays!! Seems like lately anything I order is either poor quality or horrible fit. 
In the case of these pants, I ordered 3 pairs, one in each color. I couldn’t believe how tight the waist was and how awkwardly the inseam felt. As if they just designed this without actually trying it on a human! 
Returning ALL 3 pants. So disappointed in Marmot.
review.name: Awful! Just awful!

review.reviewBody:
I bought this harness with the intention to use it for rescue work. I wanted something with a bigger waist belt to really spread out the load, in particular for low angle scree evacuations where the weight of the litter and patient is hanging down from the harness. And while I haven't gotten to put it to that particular test yet I think It will do it nicely.
Probably my favorite feature, unexpectedly, is the double belay loops! It's actually super helpful for anytime a lot is going on at the harness. We were practicing some personal on rope skills with ascending and descending ropes, passing knots, and so on and the extra loop made the organization of the various pieces of equipment MUCH easier to manage. 100% recomend the double belay loops.
However, this is a BIG harness. It takes up a LOT of space in my pack which means it's ONLY going to be appropriate for working off the side of the road. Anywhere where I need to carry a harness in, this one just isn't going to be useful. And most annoyingly, in addition to the width of the waist belt and leg loops being wide they are also THICK. Wearing this harness feels a lot like wearing a full diaper. Not ideal. Overall I think this harness seems well built and like a decent harness (and it IS comfy to sit in at least for a few minutes at a time, more so that many harnesses) but may not work for my particular application as well as I had hoped.
review.name: Some good, some not so good

review.reviewBody: I loved the 2 belay loops and firm gear loops but alas the harness was too large for me! They don't seem to make an XS. Too bad.
review.name: almost perfect....but too large
comment: There's 4 XS's in stock now.... 12/10/21

review.reviewBody:
From the perspective of a route setter these are the best and other setters I've worked with agree.  I have to spend most of my time hanging in the harness and the other 10% of the time trying out moves.  A burly chest harness is more comfy but you can't really work hard moves wearing those.  This is comfortable enough to hang in for a couple hours at a time. The gear loops are full strength for clipping into the wall at weird angles to find the perfect angle to remove a tight hold.  Two belay loops because sometimes it's nice to have an extra.  Extra gear loops because you've got to carry so much crap up the wall with you.  


There isn't really an other harness like it and it's much better than every other climbing harness for route setting.  I have used it climbing outside a few times when I'm in a bind and I need an extra harness and it is admittedly bulky for some climbs outside.  I can see how it could make a tight chimney just a bit tighter, but you do definitely appreciate that cushion while belaying for an extended period of time.  In a low key setting where I'm belaying kids or teaching a friend it's my preferred harness.  The thing is like climbing with a sofa to sit in, actually comparable to the comfort offered by a bosun chair.


It's definitely not the harness I use for projecting, but for 50% of the climbing I do, and 100% percent of the gym work I've done this is the best by a wide margin.  I'll be buying an other one here soon once mine finally wears out.  I've been using it for about 4 years heavily and I'm excited to get a new one.
review.name: Absolute best for route setting
comment: As a new gym employee and someone who just started route setting this is exactly the point of view review I?ve been looking for! Someone?s views on this as a setting and teaching harness is just what I needed. Thanks!

review.reviewBody: This harness has so much padding, which makes it super comfortable when hanging in it all day, but makes it so bulky to pack and climb in. I end up choosing my other harness over nearly every time. I like the adjustability in it, the padding, and the fact that even the gear loops are rated, but the bulk outweighs those points (pun intended).
review.name: Comfy but Bulky

name: Safe Tech Waldo Harness

review.itemreviewed: Cross Trail FX 1 Superlite Trekking Poles
review.reviewBody:
I am VERY pleased with my new poles... YAHOO!

I will be running my first 100 mile next month.  The quick release gloves and quick push button take down features are far above my expectations.  Looking forward to MANY awesome miles with my Leki Crosstrail FX.One Superlites!!!

Keep up the good work Leki!!
review.name: Lovin' My New Leki Poles!!

review.itemreviewed: Cross Trail FX 1 Superlite Trekking Poles
review.reviewBody: Pretty amazing tool for trail running.  I use Leki poles with the trigger grips for skiing and will never go back to old school grips.  These grips work just as well on running trails.  The shark grip is comfortable and transfers power seamlessly.  The cork adds another layer of comfort.
review.name: Take trail running to the next level

review.itemreviewed: Cross Trail FX 1 Superlite Trekking Poles
review.reviewBody: I love these poles! Easy to use and easy to collapse. Worth the investment!
review.name: Love!

review.itemreviewed: Cross Trail FX 1 Superlite Trekking Poles
review.reviewBody: Long time fan of Leki for skiing, it was natural to try the trail poles as I trained and raced for my first Ultra. Highly recommend
review.name: Game changer for ultra marathon

review.itemreviewed: Cross Trail FX 1 Superlite Trekking Poles
review.reviewBody: These are nice light poles that seem strong enough to last.  They are easy to fold up and assemble.  However the hand straps that clip into the poles are very itchy. They are made of a plastic material that has fibers which scratch my hand. They will be fine with gloves but I will need to figure something else out for summer use.
review.name: Light poles with itchy straps
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback on the LEKI Cross Trail Poles. We are thrilled to hear that you are enjoying using them. However, we are sorry to hear that you are experiencing some discomfort with the straps. It's possible that some of the material in the straps is poking through the mesh irritating your skin. Our top priority is your comfort, our Customer Service team will be happy to provide you with a replacement pair of straps and ensure you are fully satisfied with your purchase.

review.itemreviewed: Cross Trail FX 1 Superlite Trekking Poles
review.reviewBody: These are super light, durable, and comfortable in the hand.
review.name: So light and comfortable

name: Cross Trail FX 1 Superlite Trekking Poles

review.reviewBody: The most comfortable snow and rain boot I have ever brought that was forth the cost!
review.name: Love The Boot

review.reviewBody: these are the best rubber boot on the market. If you’re like me and are in them pretty much all day every day when you are home, then these are for you. Super comfortable with support!!
review.name: My 2nd pair!! i live in these!! 😊

review.reviewBody: Best rubber boot I’ve ever owned! All day comfort.
review.name: Worth the money!

review.reviewBody:
This boot is durable and waterproof.
Since the entire boot is waterproof, it's easy to clean and stands up to deep puddles, mud, etc. This also makes the boot very heavy, so my feet and legs are tired after wearing them all day.
The shaft is plenty wide enough to tuck in my jeans, but a lot of hay gets inside the boot and won't come out easily.
The buckle and strap on the shaft seem purely ornamental and won't stay buckled.
review.name: Pros and Cons
comment: Thank you for your feedback on this boot.  We so appreciate you taking the time to leave a review.  Please contact info@ariat.com or give us a call at 1-877-702-7428  if you need further assistance in this matter.

review.reviewBody: Nice sturdy boots. Fit true to size. I have the mid calf which are a little wide on my legs but then again my calf's are skinny. Very cushioned. Feel heavier than my old Hunters (but they split so glad of a thicker rubber)
review.name: Nice sturdy boots

review.reviewBody: Quality, comfort and warmth! Wouldn’t expect anything less from Ariat is the best! 💕
review.name: Love these! 💕

review.reviewBody: Love this style and they are comfortable and easy to put on and take off.
review.name: Excellent Choice

review.reviewBody: These are the perfect height & weight. They remind me a lot of my Fat baby boots in terms of comfort
review.name: boots are so comfortable, functional, and stylish!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent for rainy dog walks, heavy duty farm/ranch work or to make a fashion statement.. i have the camo/leopard. Thats my thing.. leopard. I love them. Runs small. I sized up a half size based on other ariat shoes i have purchased. I have a wide toe box. The other thing i LOVE is the amount of cushion and support. I have done ranch work in Florida for some folks where I travel down to care for farm/horses/property. 20k steps a day in flat Muck brand boots KILLED my body.  These on the hand offer a tremendous amount of support for the heavy duty work. I will report back on how long they last. But i would imagine by the durable heavy dury quality, they have years of life!!
review.name: Fashionable. Heavy Duty! AMAZING COMFORT & SUPPORT

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have worn them everyday day since I got them. I take the dog out every morning and rain or shine, dew drops first thing in the morning. Fit great.
review.name: Love these boots

name: Kelmarsh Mid Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great little outdoor blanket, reminds me of an old army woobie.

Great blanket for extra warmth when you need it. When I first took a look at it, I was  little concerned about the thickness. I was thinking no way this thing would be warm, but I was wrong. It does a good job and when my kids got cold, I would throw this on top of there sleeping bags and they were warm all night. You can really compress down pretty small and bring it with you with the bulk. I ended up buying three in total so no more battles on who gets it.
review.name: great blanket

review.reviewBody:
Enjoying this so much that I'm finding my sleeping bag hasn't even been unpacked on a couple of trips this year .
Light, warm for weight and packs small.
Time will tell how it holds up but still good after a year of use.
review.name: Great camping blanket

review.reviewBody: Bought two to keep in our vehicles.  It has already come in hand for cold weather sporting events.
review.name: Great Blanket

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, packs down well. Great for just chilling around the campsite or in your hammock outside in the fall.
It is a very light blanket. Not as cozy as their other blankets, but again its for a quick and light throw and go type of blanket
review.name: Light.

review.reviewBody: Great blanket for everything from living room sofa, to car emergency blanket, to sitting around the campfire. (Watch out for sparks)
review.name: Love these blankets

review.reviewBody: I've used this blanket countless times for all sorts of reasons. It's thinner than expected but still very warm, and blocks the wind. Great size for a travel blanket
review.name: Great blanket to keep in your car!

review.reviewBody: I've taken this blanket hunting and camping and even for general travel or around the house. It's very warm it's lightweight and packs down small so easy to stow and bring along. No issues with machine washing either
review.name: Versatile blanket

review.reviewBody: Overall a good blanket. Light weight and well made blanket for outdoor use have used many times.
review.name: Klymit - Horizon Travel Blanket

name: Horizon Travel Blanket

review.reviewBody:
After these, I refuse to wear anything else. They are super comfortable.  The wider footbed, cooling and body geometry that hits perfectly as you put your foot down, discrete white colorway, quality construction, easy to clean, etc, etc.

I am a fan.
review.name: After these, I dont wear anything else.

review.reviewBody: I Upgraded to these shoes.  They are stiff and lightweight.  Probably the best feature are dual Boa dials which allow you to precisely adjust fit.
review.name: Look great

review.reviewBody: I’ve been looking for a new shoe that would fit like an older pair that I can longer get. I have slightly wide feet and have been unable to find a super comfortable lightweight, but stiff road bike shoe. The S-Works Torch is a great shoe for me. I highly recommend it.
review.name: Comfortable stiff great fit!

review.reviewBody:
CLOTHING:  Shoes are unquestionably the MOST important item to purchase for comfort and function on the bike.  The best hardware will never make you a World Pro, but this purchase for your ride will give you a lifetime of pleasure.

Fits like a slipper and true to size, Specialized finally came up with the Torch model that matches the price -- far surpassing its competitors. Only a custom made shoe could be in the same conversation, but at a price far beyond my means. After sizing, it was suggested that I get the Yellow orthotic for my High Arches, to give me the best fit.

Note: Olive Green to complement the Castelli Climber jerseys, Green and Beaujolais.
review.name: A product that matches the $ break-point

review.reviewBody: Enjoying my new Torch and loving it! Big thanks to the crew helping me with my lost package, and expedited the delivery. Shoes made it to my bike fitting appointment. Thanks and great job guys! Really appreciate it ❤️
review.name: Great shoes from a great company!

name: S-Works Torch Cycling Shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought these at the beginning of summer to be my sailing, boating, on water glasses and loved every second wearing them. Unfortunately some coating has started to bubble around the edges and I am afraid that their days of numbered after one a few months. Pictures are hard to show the delaminating. Contact me please

comment: Sorry that you're having issues with your lenses, and glad we were able to get you a replacement kit. Please let us know how they are holding up!

review.reviewBody:
I bought these 2 years ago and they were not what I expected at first. Had a lot of visibility up high and wide, nothing I was used to and took some adjusting to with regular, casual use. I had bought a pair of these "active" sunglasses cause I liked the look online and the name velo... I should have put it together that they were great for cycling, but I didn't until I wore them out riding. I'm an avid biker and low and behold I stumbled upon my favorite cycling sunnies. The vision with your head down is superb and they are great for beach volleyball as well. The upper brow on these fits hats and helmets like a gem. I saw some other comments about wind and odd distortion. Had none of that, so with a fixed bridge its likely a little dependent on nose shape. Albeit my schnoz is wicked broken so these must have a nice general fit. Additionally, they clean so easily. I'm a greasy beach, dirt, rain, snow, sweat covered individual when I get going, and these would basically get clean with a shirt wipe, never really scratched either even when I accidentally would grind some sand in there. 

I ended up wearing these anytime I needed sunglasses, they are even interesting enough to fit in nicely if you dress them up, something like a polarized chameleon. Most comments I get are "I've never seen shades like those" which I take as a fat compliment.  Really awesome specs for the price and stand up tall against some of the crazy expensive brands like District Vision. 

These bad boys took me to Zion, Boulder, San Diego, and more. Sadly, I lent them out during a roof party and never saw them again. It's been months and I just got a "fancy" expensive pair for the summer after get sick of staring into the sun. Within a few days, I already missed the velo's and just now placed an order for another pair. Can't wait for round 2. 

(I had the all black pair and bought those again, unsure of the low light lenses are, but I love the grey/black lenses for my sensitive blue eyes. Lots of shade and very clear vision still without feeling too dark.)
review.name: Can't wait for 2nd pair.

review.reviewBody: My new favorite cycling sunglasses.  They're light weight and provide enough coverage to keep the dust out of my eyes without interfering with my helmet or pressing on my cheeks.
review.name: Cycling dream

review.reviewBody: These are the perfect sunglasses for mountain and road biking that don't look like the glasses that everyone else is wearing. They are super lightweight and I've been very pleased with the quality so far! The bronze is perfect for most days, not too dark and not too light.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to like these. I think the styling is some of the best looking for glasses that wrap around the face. However, I found two major problems with these glasses:
1. The optical quality wasn't that great. My pair had significant distortion/bulging that was distracting.
2. The nose bridge is handsome, but lets in too much wind when riding downhill.

Overall, I would not recommend these for cycling to anyone.
review.name: Poor optical quality and too much wind
comment: Hi! Sorry to hear about that experience. We've tried cycling with this ourselves and loved it. But if you want to exchange them for a different pair let us know!

review.reviewBody: Breathe great, wonderful field of vision, and great protection from wind and debris. They are a bit under-tinted for summer in the desert, but work great with a cycling cap.
review.name: Perfect for bicycling.

review.reviewBody: Most comfortable, lightest cycling glasses ever. Would recommend.
review.name: Ultimate recreational cycling glasses

name: Velo Polarized Sunglasses

hasVariant.description: Buy the Freedom Foil Boards Freedom Wing online or shop all Wake from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very high-end quality and design you would expect from a top tier kite/wing brand. Wing has exceptional power in light winds but also handles gusty conditions very well. Long rigid handles makes it super easy when tacking and controlling the wing during turns. Very intuitive scuff guards on the wing tips that  have definitely saved me from some premature abrasion when walking around in the parking lot with wing inflated. The range is probably the most impressive feature of this wing. I have been able to use the 6 meter in 12-25 kts.
review.name: Wing for all conditions

review.reviewBody:
The 6m will get you up and flying in real low wind, and the 4m has more power than most 4m's I've ridden. 

These wings are light and easy to use. Handle placements is on point! High viz green never hurts either, little piece of mind way out in the deep blue. 

Luffing is a joy, they fly nice and straight and give some nice hang time as well!
review.name: High Viz & Easy Riding

review.reviewBody: The Freedom Wing has been a blast to ride. I have both the 4 and 6 meter sizes. Both sizes are easy to fly and have good power to get up on foil. What blows me away about this wing is how stable it is when holding onto the leading edge handle. The wing stays in place and allows me to focus on riding chop or working on my pumping.
review.name: Fun Surf Wing

name: Freedom Wing
