review.itemreviewed: Tofane NW GTX RR Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fits like a glove on your feet. Had the 396 as first model and decided to upgrade to these. Had owned every boot available and these won’t give any kind of fatigue even wearing them all day.
review.name: The last boot you’ll ever get

review.itemreviewed: Tofane NW GTX RR Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This are the best hiking boots!!
I’ve done plenty of hiking, climbing, and mountaineering and over the years couldn’t find a solid pair of boots. I’ve tried lots of them and they all break apart on heavy terrain until I got the Tofane. This boots are incredibly strong and comfortable for long hikes. I took this for a 6 week expedition to Patagonia. Hiked over 150 miles and prevailed. They took a massive beating on mountain rocks, glaciers, river crossings, climbing, and unpredictable weather. They always kept my feet dry and blister free. If you’re going on a rough all terrain expedition and are looking for a reliable pair of boots then this are the best option. The only caveat is You MUST break them in weeks if not months before your journey. I spent 2 months breaking them in using them daily but I recommend you break them in by going on short hikes. Your feet need to get use to the boots bc they are a bit heavily and the leather if very rigid. If you don’t break them in you will hate them I promise. 

Also, I recommend wearing a liner sock under you wool ones when using this boots for best comfort. 

5 stars
review.name: 5 stars Killer Boots.

review.itemreviewed: Tofane NW GTX RR Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Dare I say it? This is the best boot I've ever worn. Caveat I've only had them for a few days. Very comfy right out of the box. The fit is good for me. I'd say I have a relatively low-volume foot and while they feel wide enough to not cramp me but still snug enough to keep my narrow foot secure. Typically I wear either 10.5 or an 11. I got an 11 in these and although I feel pretty good in them with thinner socks, I can wear big phatties and get a bit more insulation. They look about as good as leather "everything boots" can.
review.name: The Holy Grail

review.itemreviewed: Tofane NW GTX RR Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have had these boots for several months now.  I have put many miles hiking the trails in the park by my home not to mention wearing them all day while running errands, but have yet to take them on a major backpacking trip.  That said my local trail involves jumping small streams, paths filled with mud, tree roots and rocks on steep descents as well as ascents; although it is for yards at a time and not miles up and down those steep inclines.  I tie these boots tight and they have seemed to have formed very well to my feet.  They seem to wrap each of my foot with a comfortable and gentle "pressure" all around, from the top, sides and heel.  I have not wanted an insert for comfort, as the supplied footbed insert is quite comfortable as it is.  The smell of the high quality leather is intoxicating and the light cognac color is beautiful.  The front toe is wrapped in a scuff shielding material and it comes in handy as it has protected the leather many times.  I have not taken it easy on these boots and they take anything I throw at them in stride.  All day comfort and by that I mean 16 to18 hour days from grocery shopping and daily chores to the 3 separate hour and a half long walks I take with my dog in the trails on my days off, these boots don't come off and my feet are in better shape than in anything else except a Nike Airmax or Adidas Ultraboost. That sort of things is unthinkable in a heavy duty boot like this. Amazing ankle support and the treads of the Vibram outsoles grip wet roots, rocks and anything else on rain soaked trails without the faintest hint of slip.  Walks through shin high grass right after a heavy rain turn the top of the boots darker for a short time and that's it.  Not even a hint of any water leaking inside or even the feeling of water build up.  They are also pretty warm given that they're not insulated boots. I think these will do very well in winter and in snow.  As much time as I spent in these on hot and humid days in the trails, they weren't running very hot either.  They breathe extremely well for a solid boot that's made of leather, just don't expect Adidas Primeknit Climacool sneakers levels of breathing because it would be ridiculous to have that and expect any kind of waterproofness.  I always wanted a pair of Zamberlans and when I saw these on a 30% sale at Backcountry, I just had to jump on it; and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.  The leather will sustain marks and scuffs with the kind of rugged use they were intended to do, but that's just building character into them.  Between that and the creases you may put in them over time is what makes them uniquely yours.  These aren't a pair of Ferragamo dress shoes. Embrace that patina and don't be afraid to beat them up, they can take it.
In summary:

Things I love:
Comfort, Waterproofness, Aesthetics, Smell and quality of the leather used and the obvious craftsmanship, All day comfort, Ankle support, Grip of the Vibram outsoles.

Things I Don't Like:
Having to double knot laces to keep them from untying.


Can't wait to take these hiking in Alaska and the parks in the Northeast in NY, Vermont, and Maine.
review.name: Tofane: All About Comfort And Quality

review.itemreviewed: Tofane NW GTX RR Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've owed these boots for 4 years now and I love them. Used them for yard work for 3 years. 2020 I did 45 mile wilderness backpacking all above 8000 feet in this boot.

Pro's 
They will keep your feet dry and they are warm. Excellent traction on most surfaces, some loss of traction on wet granite. Very stable on difficult trails. Great leather no cracks at all, I use Obenauf's to water proof and maintain the leather.

Con's
They are heavy and hot in the summer. Also everyone is correct they are hard on your achilles just above the heal. After a ton of experimenting I found that I needed to loosen the boots and I never had a problem after that. 

I did end up with a half size smaller than I normally wear. 

Excellent boot 4 years later and then still look great and preformed perfectly on my 6 days if backpacking.
review.name: Heavy duty!

review.itemreviewed: Tofane NW GTX RR Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been hiking in Alaska for the last 25 years and have been through many boots. I decided to splurge on these and have worn them for a few weeks now. They were comfy out of the box, and their size chart is spot on. I was worried they would be too small based on my past shoe size of 9.5 in almost every shoe. Zamberlan recommended a size 9, and these boots fit like a glove. Plus my toes have plenty of room to move which is what I think makes a difference. I can hike farther with less foot pain and fatigue. I easily hike 50 miles a week, and these are the best for me. I will definitely pick up another pair of these when in need of another pair of boots. This being said, I wouldn't wear these boots if I were doing heavy backpacking for days at a time. Up here in Alaska, backcountry hiking in the interior of the state is usually without trails, and I would wear a heavier boot like the LaSportiva Makalu which is heavier and sturdier. These Zamberlans are for light backpacking and long day hikes.
review.name: Amazing boots

name: Tofane NW GTX RR Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: One look at a chris king headset and your friends will be fuming with jealousy.  I bought the gold headset and it is super smoooth and looks great.
review.name: Make your Friends Jealous

review.reviewBody:
Very high quality especially compared to the mild steel bearing IS-2 that came on my Cervelo.  All of the pieces look great and should last forever.

Assembly is another story - so far it is impossible to get the upper bearing snug enough to keep it quiet over hard bumps.  Twisting the fork back & forth while torquing definitely helps but doesn't quite get me there.

If I go back to the F*A upper bearing & cap, with the spec'd preload of 17 lb-in, I immediately have a quiet setup.  I ride the DropSet 40 to 50 miles, release the bearing cap and stem bolts, retorque while twisting and ride another 50.  I'm hoping I'll eventually achieve quiet.
review.name: Nice parts - hard to get a good preload

review.reviewBody:
It was a drop in easy swap of Head sets from my Cane Creek to the Chris King. Much easier than on the older bikes with bearings that are pressed in. The upper and lower Chris King bearings drop right in on my 2020 Yeti SB140. 
The only challenge I had was trying to get the Cane Creek crown race off the Fox shock. i use to use a screw driver and hammer to get these off in my older bikes. But this one was on really tight with no crack large enough to get a screw driver in. Took shock to my local bike shop and they took the Cane Creek off and put the Chris King crown race on. Took them 15 minutes and they didn't even charge me. The new crown race came with the Chris King headset I purchased so you shouldn't need to buy it separately.
Since my Cane Creek headset was less than 6 months old, it really didn't need replacement, but I bought the Chris King Headset for the turquoise bling. Once I installed it, I felt this new purchase to be fully justified. It  did improve my bike, Front end felt more solid and these bearings are so smooth. 
The best part was I was able to install my Cane Creek headset onto my Son's Yeti as a replacement for his creaky old head set. 
If you have a high end bike the Chris King Headset is a most awesome upgrade bling bling or no bling.
review.name: Bought the Turquoise for the bling

name: DropSet 3 Headset

description: Buy the Outdoor Research Skytour AscentShell Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Skytour AscentShell Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Skytour AscentShell Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The jacket is good. Overall it is fit well and is OK to adjust. The little grommet clips to adjust the waist are very difficult to manipulate. My main problem is the 2-way zipper. It is extremely difficult to operate. Impossible to do one-handed and often requires you to stop and try several times to get the zipper seated correctly. I do not need/want the 2-way zipper. It would be fine if it worked but it does not work.
review.name: Nice jacket. Do not like the zipper

review.reviewBody: Water resistant. Worn in a couple of heavy rains and stayed comfortably dry. Fit, as advertised. Wrist velcro sizing and zippers are an improvement over previous models. Style and color really stand out and garner compliments!
review.name: GREAT light ski jacket!

review.reviewBody: My experience after 1 month: - Comfortable jacket, moves freely without crinkling. Have gotten compliments on the green colour. - Light rain and snow beads off it (good DWR), I'm confident it will hold up in the snow. - Breathable, but also seems to keep most of the wind out (at least with a good puffer). - Jacket is a great length (below hips so the jacket doesn't come over up too much when reaching up). Less boxy than many other shells I've tried recently. A good athletic fit. Pairs well with a fleece/puffer. Tighter around hips, but this might be to compensate for the lack of internal waist gaiter. - Big hood - it bunches up a bit when cinched down without a helmet. - Lots of nice big pockets (2 hip, 2 chest, 1 internal) with good, waterproof, zippers (no velcro). The hip pockets sometimes get in the way when moving your arms back and forth - so I keep the zippers closed. - The pit zips are massive and don't have mesh backing and open wide. I haven't had to use them much due to the breathability of the jacket. They also have 2 way zippers, so I usually use both to manage the size of the pit opening. I often bring both zippers to the middle to allow - The cuffs are huge and, without gloves, there is a lot of bunching when velcroed smaller. The extra fabric annoyingly rubs against my wrists, but the material has soften up a little since I got it. - Ascentshell uses "Electrospinning" to make the fabric... but I can't final anywhere that indicates whether or not it uses PTFE/ XPTFE. www.outdoorresearch.com/en-ca/blogs/stories/the-science-behind-ascentshell-technology
review.name: Comfortable Shell - Does it use PTFE/XPTFE?

review.reviewBody: I am 6 foot tall with a 40.5'' chest. And M size perfectly fits me. Haven't tried it on yet. The quality looks pretty good.
review.name: Perfectly fits my size and high quality made

review.reviewBody: The perfect Ski shell, so light and flexible but holds in heat and keeps water out. Very happy with this purchase
review.name: Excellent Product

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket last month and after only 9 days of resort riding the jacket already shows signs of distress at and around the seams. Disappointed and wished I spent the extra money to get something better.
review.name: Good looking jacket but lacks durability

review.reviewBody:
To me, anyway, this jacket seems to be made very well.  I thought it had a powder skirt, which it doesn't, but that was most likely my mistake.  

As for sizing.  I generally wear a Medium to medium slim.  I have a long torso at 5' 9' with a 29" inseam.  Yet, this jacket was long in the body and 4" long in the sleeve,  So order a size down and take your chances.  I am returning mine.
review.name: All in all a great shell however...

review.reviewBody: Had the jacket for 2.5 weeks and have put in 11 days on the mountain. it has been my new go to jacket. 7 days in the backcountry and 4 resort days. conditions have ranged from a sunny day to full on storm skiing. The Skytour jacket has shown to be a great fit, holds up in weather keeping me dry on wet days, while being breathable during the uphill climb on the skin track. The material has shown to be durable while charging through the trees and slapping branches (other jackets have not held up).
review.name: Great Jacket - Holds Up to the abuse

review.reviewBody: I've just used this shell touring. All the ventilation zippers make it the perfect jacket to wear. The pits and front (from top or bottom) can be opened to air out. There's great storage with the 2 front chest pockets and 2 hand pockets. It runs a little big (I'm 6'1" using the Large) so it's got room to layer below for really cold days.
review.name: Great shell for touring or inbounds!

review.reviewBody: Jacket has been one of my favorite shells I've owned. Awesome waterproofing, great fit, well constructed. Can't say anything bad!
review.name: Awesome color, hardy gear

name: Skytour AscentShell Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This pillow is fantastic! Lightweight and very comfortable... I always bring this pillow with me when I'm out on the trail.
review.name: Wide pillow perfection

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] i bought this pillow for my husband, because it was the "tallest" packable pillow for bike camping. He is a big guy, and needs more support... it also reduced his snoring -which i why i bought it.
review.name: sound sleep

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Had the pillow for a few years until it developed an overnight leak. Pillow was replaced under waranty.with no issues 5 stars. Will continue.to do business with sea to summet.
review.name: Had the pillow for a

review.reviewBody:
I own five pillows for backpacking, tried to find the one, well this so far is it. At first I didn’t like it a whole lot as its really wide inflated, it seemed unnecessary in wide at first. After using it I see why its so wide because thats one reason its so comfortable. Best if used fully inflated as it adds more than enough height for a side slipper. Your head wont be hanging low. Its so wide the weight of your head is distributed well and it does a great job not feeling like your sleeping on a inflated balloon like some pillows. The “dimples” also do a great job of adding comfort and not adding pressure points laying on it. Its light enough I don’t feel bad as a luxury item in my gear as a pillow of your tenting is so important for good sleep. 
I am exclusively a side sleeper and this is the only pillow that fits the need to make it comfortable.
review.name: Side Sleepers buy this

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this pillow. Nice and thick while keeping the weight light and packing up very small. Great addition to my sleep system! I’m a side sleeper so I need a pillow of this height. Nice that is come packaged in a little stuff sack.
review.name: Perfect for side sleepers

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have tried several different backpacking pillows and so far this is the best. Not as light as the Fillo Elite but because it’s larger it doesn’t feel like you’re sleeping on a balloon as some of the others do!!
review.name: Have tried several different backpacking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It was as I expected, a great size, lightweight, and perfect height for me being a side sleeper.
review.name: All I wanted

review.reviewBody: I love this pillow. Not the lightest but still pretty light and gives plenty of support.
review.name: I love this pillow. Not

review.reviewBody: This pillow is amazing. Has adequate height to properly support your head while side sleeping. The baffle design really makes it feel more soft while maintaining shape. I have been using it as my main pillow at home the last few nights and I am really impressed.
review.name: The only inflatable pillow with enough height for side sleepers

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very helpful addition to Ether Light XT Insulated Air Sleeping Mat: I am 6'6 and have 230 lbs, and this pillow together with the mat gives me the same comfort as my home bed.
Top recommendation!
review.name: Great product

name: Aeros Ultralight Premium Deluxe Pillow

review.reviewBody: Despite the fabric being comfortable and breathable, it’s not enough to justify purchasing these specific pants. The cut of these are extremely off. I will admit I’m fairly short at 5’3” but these pants come up to my chest. If I try to pull them down so the waistband is roughly where it is sitting on the model in the photos, the crotch then is completely baggy and sitting in the middle of my thighs. The material also stretches out within minutes of wearing them, creating a saggy look in your butt. I’m disappointed that I wasted so much money on these. They leave so much to be desired and I now have a pair of pants that’s so long and out of shape that it creates discomfort to wear them, resulting in me never reaching for them in my closet. Do better, Backcountry.
review.name: Don’t waste your money

review.reviewBody: These pants are definitely one size smaller than listed. The crotch is really really long in these and looks super weird. It would make sense if they had a super wide leg but they don’t. Definitely size up if you want any chance of these fitting. If you buy the shorts version, which I did, those are actually true to size. So this is definitely poor quality control and not just this company’s sizing.
review.name: Sizing way off and cut weird

review.reviewBody:
I bought these in a medium, my usual size, and they fit well. On me, they are full-length because I am 5’1” and too lazy to make alterations unless it’s essential. For reference,  I weigh around 135-138lbs, and my waist is 28.5- 29 inches. I am pretty happy with these pants. 

The shorts, on the other hand,  were at least 2” too big around the waist in a medium. In small, they fit, but I thought maybe I would like them
To be a little larger through the hips and thighs. I should have kept the size small shorts. I ended up reordering them. I find it strange that they are so different, and there is a very significant difference between the sizes of the shorts. I can’t be sure about the pants, but I would suggest if you believe they might fit slightly better in another size but they do fit you, that you keep them until you get the other size and try them on. I have my fingers crossed that the sizes are consistent within the item, or I could be making a mistake (again). Overall,  they are cute for the price, and they will be helpful in this summer’s hot weather.
review.name: They’re Cute, but This Line is Strange.

review.reviewBody: I ordered these in black in a size small based on the photos and also because that is my usual go to size. They were very small, and not flowy at all. Returned. These pants would be great if the sizing wasn’t so difficult to figure out and not worth paying the return shipping fee to do so.
review.name: Sizing issues

review.reviewBody: First off, everyone who has written a review has said it runs small. It most definitely does not. I normally don't write reviews, but the reviews on this led me wrong. I size up based on what people were saying. It is most definitely TRUE TO SIZE. For reference, I am 5'4", athletic build, and weigh 138-140lbs. I ordered a M and they almost fall off my waist! I could size down to a S or maybe even an XS. My normal size is around a 4 for reference. I hope this helps people and you are led astray because other that than, these pants are super lightweight and airy which I love!
review.name: Sizing

review.reviewBody:
I should have listened to the single review that said these ran so small. I’m actually not sure how the model is wearing a small and they look they oversized? They were extremely fitted and not flowy or the fit of what you’d expect from pants like this. Also the high waist in the front is almost too high. Doesn’t feel like you could front tuck your shirt but also hard to imagine when they don’t fit how they fit on the model. 

Very disappointed. Considered exchanging for another size but not sure that’ll be enough.
review.name: Fitted and not oversized at all.

review.reviewBody: I’m usually a medium 8/10 and these were so tight and unflattering. I ordered at medium, I think to get the loose fit I’d need at XL. Sad, there are no more sizes. This is the pant I’ve been looking for!
review.name: Run so small.

review.reviewBody: Will these be restocked soon??  They look exactly what I’ve been looking for.
review.name: Restock??

name: Cotton Gauze Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
We've had this bike rack for about a year. It is fine for transporting bikes. But when we're not transporting bikes, we want the arms pointing down. One of the arms moves relatively easily when I loosen the clip that tightens it in place, but the other one does not even when the clip is totally loose. Sometimes I can loosen the arm by prying at the hinger with a screwdriver, but other times I end up taking the clip off and hammering on the bolt to loosen it.
We owned an earlier version of this rack for many years--it was a little less robust but great to use.
review.name: arms that hold bikes

review.reviewBody: Had been struggling to find a 3 bike car rack that didn't need a trailer hitch and would fit a VW Tiguan.   Used the website tool to determine whether it would fit my vehicle and found it would so ordered it.   Purchase and shipping tracking worked well and it arrived about a week later at the post office.   Got around to giving a try to install it one week later.   The instructions are not great particularly viz a viz the anti-sway support that is on one of the two bike frame supports and it folds down 90 degrees.   Fortunately there were YouTube videos that set me straight.    It is simple to install after the first time and holds the bikes firmly in place.   I have 3 bikes with 56 and 58 frame sizes and it's plenty roomy.    Highly recommend!
review.name: Great Product - Instruction could be better.

review.reviewBody:
Simply the worst instruction booklet I have ever seen.
No directions on how to access the Fit Guide.
Bleh.
review.name: The Worst Installation Instructions of All Time
comment:
Hello Harry,
Thank  you for providing your feedback on the Thule Gateway Pro fit instructions. I understand your frustration with the lack of information on Thule.com. Our website is currently in the process of a large overhaul and update. Our online team is working hard to resolve the issue with trunk bike rack fitment information displaying correctly. In the meantime, please contact Thule Customer Support for assistance in fitting your Thule Gateway Pro to your vehicle.

review.reviewBody: I've been using my Gateway to carry an EZ Rider recumbent.  None of the hitch mount carriers I've found can accommodate recumbent wheel-bases so this is perfect!
review.name: Great features, easily assembled

review.reviewBody:
I opted for the 3 bike option and, unless I remove the pedals off all my bikes, I will never be able to fit three bikes on the rack. Not only would the bike closest to my car scratch my car,  it's already a tight squeeze with 2 bikes on the 3 bike option.

The system is also really difficult to fit on most mountain bikes because the support buckles are so large, which is super unfortunate. We ended up having to get another bike because one of our mountain bikes was completely impossible to get on the rack because it's frame wasn't the standard "triangle" Thule assumes it is. 

It is also a huge pain that there is no built in way to lock it to your car (and the car lock Thule sells separately can be easily cut), so we have to disassemble it and put it away in our car every time we go on a trip so that we can be sure it isn't easily stolen. That's a big pain too.

All that said, I'm glad I got this as it is going the job for now. But, I will likely consider upgrading to something more expensive because I am also pretty disappointed.

Bought the Thule Gateway Pro 3 for a 2010 chevy cobalt.
review.name: Light, but a pain in the butt

review.reviewBody: I had this installed by my bike shop. The straps popped off and scratched my car. I then couldn’t get the tightened off the bike, had to cut it. Livid.
review.name: Didn’t last 1 ride
comment:
Thank you for letting us know about the issues with your Thule Gateway Pro 3. 
A member of the Thule Customer Support team reached out via email to get some more information and start the warranty claims process. If you are still having issue with your bike rack, please respond to that email so we can best help in finding a solution to the problem.

review.reviewBody: I forgot to tie the straps together that I wasn't using, and they fell out. Now I'm trying to find replacement straps, but getting these exact ones is proving kinda hard. Not recommended for this simple, but perhaps costly, annoyance.
review.name: Tie-down straps fell out on first trip
comment:
I'm sorry for the inconvenience in finding replacement straps. I'm glad we were able to connect via email and resolve that issue. 

Replacement parts can be found in the Spare Parts section of Thule.com, or full replacement Ratcheting Strap Kits can be accessed through the "Accessories" section of the product page.

review.reviewBody: Not really anything wrong with the bike rack per se, but in the instruction booklet half the pages were blank/missing and there are missing pieces on the rack. On the underside of three of the bike rests, the covers were not installed.
review.name: Disappointed with our first Thule experience.
comment:
Hi Natalie, 

Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback on the Thule Gateway Pro. I'm sorry to hear about the printing error in your instruction booklet. To find the information missing from your booklet, please take a look at the digital version in the "Downloads" section of the bike rack product page. 

The photo you posted appears to be properly assembled. Anti-sway cages are only installed on every other cradle. This is because the cage only needs to be attached to the seatpost tube and the bikes should alternate direction to remain balanced on the rack. There should be an anti-sway cage on the cradles opposite the cradles without one.

review.reviewBody: Bought the Gateway Pro 3...the bikes fit, but the bottom rubber supports which sit on the bumper split apart after 2 months. Now, a towel wrapped around the bottom is the replacement. Sadly so, on many occassions, a longer drive means that the bottom hooks come loose-it only takes few bumps in the road. Nothing has fallen off, but the feeling of insecurity as a driver lingers.
review.name: A Little Insecure

review.reviewBody: I bought this rack, installed it correctly and when I opened my truck the top fasteners gouged my car. They are rounded which means they don’t tuck out of the way. I have had other bike racks that have never done this!
review.name: Damaged my car

name: Gateway Pro 3-Bike Rack

description: Buy the MSR Alpine 4 Stainless Steel Pot Cookset online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpine 4 Stainless Steel Pot Cookset
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Alpine 4 Stainless Steel Pot Cookset online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Initial impressions, this is a great set. Surprisingly lightweight. I bought it primarily to use car camping and like that it nests easily. You need to use more oil/butter than you think to prevent sticking, a bit of a learning curve compared to ceramic pots, but I chose this one as I believe the materials will last for many, many years of use. 
Side note: I've had the stainless steel stow-a-way pot for over 15 years and it's still great. Stainless steel feels way more durable in the long haul.
review.name: Quality Pot Set

review.reviewBody: I already knew the quality of these pots, as I used to have a set in "my filthy hippie days" 30+ years ago. Now we are full time van lifers and they work exceptionally well for this too!
review.name: Filthy Hippie Loves MSR

review.reviewBody: They are a great size, nestle nice and clean up is easy!
review.name: They are a great size,

review.reviewBody: These pots are incredibly durable, and easy to maneuver with the pot grip. I wish I could purchase the large pot separately. We use these with big groups for camping and backpacking.
review.name: Durable pots. Worth the purchase

review.reviewBody: This set of pots are fantastic. I moved to these stainless steel pots after other cook sets just couldn´t hold up to the wear and tear of constant use in the Patagonia mountains. These have held up more than one season and I couldn´t be more thrilled.
review.name: Great for groups, burly and easy to clean

review.reviewBody:
I am an outdoor guide, I was on the search for a new Pot setup for our upcoming Denali expedition .

I choose to go with the Alpine 4 pot. 

Last weekend, I did some test to compare the boiling time test and the snow melting time. 

Unfortunately, the pot didn't really survived it first use. 

The base of the pot got disformed and pop-out. The pot hot fully discolorated be ause of the heat. 

To me this pot feel the same quality as one you could get at a dollar market. 

It's sad, because most of MSR product are bomber. But don't go with this one if you want something durable.

I used a MSR XGK burner for my test.

Suggest for MSR: This set is very light, but I think you went at the cost of durability. This pan doesn't have enough metal on the base to properly resist the heat generated by a burner.
review.name: Not durable and not for strong burner

review.reviewBody: good three pot set - I am not sure how the handle can be called a fourth pot, but that seems to be the case.
review.name: good three pot set -

review.reviewBody: Great set for group camping. Easy use with handle, fit and size make it all very convenient.
review.name: Durable cooking while camping

review.reviewBody: Great pans. Exactly what I was looking for for van camping.
review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: The perfect combination of pots and sizes to do rather extravagant meals in the back country.
review.name: Quality

name: Alpine 4 Stainless Steel Pot Cookset

Manuals available online and that came with the cassette are incorrect and describe a different model with a different lockring mechanism.  Pretty unimpressive, about to give up on replacing cogs and get a different brand.
review.name: You get what you pay for.

review.reviewBody: I have the latest version of this cassette, gen2, says eSpec on it. It weighs 399 grams, not the claimed 339, not a deal breaker but just sayin
review.name: weight is incorrect

hasVariant.description: Buy the Hyperlite Mountain Gear Windrider 40L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Saw the other 1 star review and could not help myself but review this pack (Got it from REI 3 years ago). 

I have used this as a daypack, as an overnight pack, as an 8 day backpacking bag, and as a multi day alpine mountaineering bag. This thing can do it all and has stood up to hundreds of miles of abuse. Do not listen to the detractors, this bag is the real deal. 

This model in particular is better due to the mesh pockets which allow you to dry things. Only this that made this bag better was buying some elastic cord to attach ice tools and crampons to the outside of the center mesh pouch using the eyelets that are already there.
review.name: Best Backpack ive ever had

review.reviewBody: Not here to troll, this pack was legitimately  the biggest waste of money ever. Everything has torn already and I haven?t had the pack long or put it through much abuse. Please save yourself the $ and frustration and consider a much more functional and durable pack. This pack has just become more disappointing each day that goes by.
review.name: Worst pack ever

name: Windrider 40L Backpack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Comfort Knit Fast Adjust Harness - Men's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Knit Fast Adjust Harness - Men's
review.reviewBody:
My first harness was a Mammut back in 2006 and after a long break from climbing I started back at the gym. Went with a brand I trusted and had history with but this is way more comfortable than what I used to have. 
I know it's not an apples and oranges and comparing the two isn't fair but I'm pretty spoiled with the wide waist belt on this harness. 
I got the XL and the waits is great but wish there was just a touch more adjustment to tighten the legs but it still feels fine. 
I'm currently only hooking to auto belays at the gym and it's a pleasant ride back down. A few unexpected falls as well and it's been flawless.
review.name: Faith in equipment

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Knit Fast Adjust Harness - Men's
review.reviewBody:
My first harness was a Mammut back in 2006 and after a long break from climbing I started back at the gym. Went with a brand I trusted and had history with but this is way more comfortable than what I used to have. 
I know it’s not an apples and oranges and comparing the two isn’t fair but I’m pretty spoiled with the wide waist belt on this harness. 
I got the XL and the waits is great but wish there was just a touch more adjustment to tighten the legs but it still feels fine. 
I’m currently only hooking to auto belays at the gym and it’s a pleasant ride back down. A few unexpected falls as well and it’s been flawless.
review.name: Faith in equipment

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Knit Fast Adjust Harness - Men's
review.reviewBody: The gear loops are angled in a way that keep things organized and in place. I really like the wear indicator technology, good job Mammut. And as the title states, this harness is very comfortable. The only thing I could pick at would be the plastic inserts inside of the tie in points. The sharp edges of the plastic are causing premature wear on my webbing I use for extended rappels.
review.name: Comfort

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Knit Fast Adjust Harness - Men's
review.reviewBody: Lives up to the name of the model - all day comfort and easy to adjust. High quality product.

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Knit Fast Adjust Harness - Men's
review.reviewBody: This harness has every feature I needed and is comfortable to boot. It has 4 ice clipper locations that are subtle and sleek. The gear loops rack cams and draws really easily. The lower tie in point is reinforced with plastic, preventing excessive wear from happening. It also features very helpful wear indicators that reveal themselves when the harness is worn too far in key structural areas. Excellent design and would recommend for anyone looking for a comfortable Sport/trad/ice/alpine harness.
review.name: Perfect All Around Harness

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Knit Fast Adjust Harness - Men's
review.reviewBody: 6ft and 160. order a large for the layers while ice climbing. Turns out I need a medium. So I ordered another one! Large was ok with 3-4 layers including shell. I am just picky, I want my adjustments to be flush. I have a 29.5 inch waist. The harness looks super cool and has all the basic features for ice rock ect. Some people may think its a little bulky for a harness, but thats what adds the comfort. The adjustments for the leg loops are capped out and only tight maybe 3 inches? SO consider that, the legs on the large fit just barely at full tightness. Although those never really have to be tight let alone snug.
review.name: Great comfy ice climbing harness

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Knit Fast Adjust Harness - Men's
review.reviewBody: Perfect for what I needed ! A very comfortable harness, I can wear it a day long with no problem.

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Knit Fast Adjust Harness - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super quality product - have used for indoor, outdoor, and ice climbing and it has not let me down.

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Knit Fast Adjust Harness - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfiest harness I have owned! Fits well and features really perform well. Gear racks are positioned to clip easily and sit great, shape means gear hangs where it should for easy reach. Ice screw clip positioning works well too. Can't speak to durability as only used it a few times but the build quality is so good I am not worried and feels like it will last for ever. Sizing is true to size, got xl for winter climbing which fits but large would have been better to be in the middle of the adjustment range.
review.name: Awesome harness! Amazing quality and comfort.

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Knit Fast Adjust Harness - Men's
review.reviewBody:
If you like the ophir just go ahead and buy this harness. The material is extremely comfortable against the skin (when climbing shirtless.) 
I really like the ice clipper slots as they make a great location for gym tags to keep them out of the way of your gear / slings. I personally bought this harness to upgrade my old sport harness and it is holding up great after nearly a year of climbing on it already.
review.name: Comfortable Sport Harness

name: Comfort Knit Fast Adjust Harness - Men's
Comfort Knit Fast Adjust Harness - Men's

review.reviewBody: This was the last one on the list. I have tried on every single full face helmet on the market now. All are too small. A lot of companies make a half shell that fits but not a single one makes a full face. Probably a good helmet if it fits you. Please help.
review.name: XXL is too small

review.reviewBody: It's light, well made and has a great balance of protection and ventilation. I was right in the middle for the medium size and when I tried it on there was so much side to side and up and down play its unusable. Sadly they do not include extra pads or liners and the medium and large share the same shell so I could not size down without going to the small/xs shell. I returned this for a different brand.
review.name: Runs large around head

review.reviewBody:
This is my first full face helmet and am truly impress with the style, weight and fit. I like the look of he raw carbon and gloss black.  The 3 way adjustment of the visor will allow goggles to placed on the forehead area. The weight of the helmet is amazing. It?s lighter than my half shell helmet and didn?t notice the weight when I wore the helmet. The helmet has a nice snug fit without added pressure. The replaceable cheek pads and helmet liner allows you to custom fit your helmet. I ordered a size medium and didn?t need to customize it. 
Overall the helmet is perfect for your first full face or as an upgrade. The SERT technology approaches head safety with an advance design. The 23 ventilations keeps you cool during longer rides or bombing downhill trails. You view is not impeded by the helmet.
review.name: Lightweight With A Snug Fit

name: Project .23 Carbon Helmet

review.reviewBody:
These are my new favorite crack climbing shoe. They have the low profile toe for slipping into hard to jamb size cracks and the flexible rubber over the tops of the toes protects well. 
I wore these climbing on Southern Utah sand stone a lot this spring and after ten years of looking I finally found the perfect crack climbing shoe. 
Size them comfortably like you would any crack climbing shoe.
review.name: Great for crack climbing!

review.reviewBody: Very high quality, great fit, very durable, and very warm
review.name: Gift for my daughter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the perfect ski pants! They have kept me warm and dry during a full day on the mountain. The vents are also perfect for if it does get a little warm.
review.name: Best Ski Pants!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought the small for my 12 year old daughter, who says they were very comfortable with plenty of stretch for skiing.  Kept her warm but did not overheat, even when skiing sunny days at about 35 degrees F. Very pleased and would buy them again.
review.name: Great Mid-Weight Pant

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality material, I appreciate the adjustable waist.  Enough insulation to keep me warm, but weather is pretty mild right now.
review.name: Quality Pants

review.reviewBody: I love the fit and feel of these snow pants. The only thing I’m a little disappointed with are the snaps. They don’t close easily and seem to be of poor quality. I expected better clothing hardware from Marmot. At least the zipper is quality.
review.name: Great pants, bad snaps

review.reviewBody: They fit comfortable in terms of movement. They are meant for a pretty specific body type-smaller waist with large thighs. They look frumpy IMO. They dont have the fit to accommodate an athletic/trendy fit. And if you aren't the specific body type they aren't flattering. They look large but not baggy. Just like I have the wrong size with no shape. If I sized down the waist would be too tight. To note I wear a 27 jeans, 138lbs. Size 4-6 in jeans, but I usually size up to a medium in athetic apparel. I bought a size medium and Im glad I did. Unless you have a very small waist, you couldn't size below the medium for a tighter fit around the legs. At 27 waist it is maxed tightness unless I wanted a pinching look. It looks like this is a motherly fit for sledding. Coming from a mom. Boxy fit. Pro is I can fit layers underneath and the color "olive green" is nice.
review.name: Comfortable but Frumpy
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our product. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

name: Slopestar Insulated Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Shoes look really nice. Unfortunately I went by the sizing chart that back country provides. I need a 9.5, which per their chart is a 44. Upon arrival I pull the shoes out, try them on, walk around in them. Thought maybe it’s because it’s “wide”. Walked around some more and just couldn’t get over how much space I have. Finally I checked the sizing on the box and shoe itself. Lo and behold, 44 = US 10. So not only did I get a 10 but a 10 wide! So of course it’s way too big. I go to the Shimano site to figure out what’s going on and there it confirmed that 44 = 10. The sizing chart needs to be updated! Returning!
review.name: Sizing issue
comment: I’m sorry for the confusion with the sizing chart. We’ve alerted our team to review the size information on our site. I’ve also reached out to you via email to assist with your order.

review.reviewBody: Cute, but thin and easily pilling material does not make it worth the price. I can tell it will not last me very long. Already a noticeable difference after one short wear.
review.name: Quite lacking with low quality fabric
comment: Hi there, thank you so much for submitting your review. We’re so sorry to hear that your recent experience with us did not live up to your expectations. Rest assured your feedback has been passed along to our team so we can do better in the future!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I sized up wanting it to be a bit looser and love that it’s still a little cropped and boxy! So many complements already
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: I want to love this! It’s SO soft and the quality is great! But it’s a tad too cropped…if I want to be cozy and warm, I also don’t want it constantly rising up my back and sides, ya know? I would also looooove a black option.
review.name: Too cropped
comment: Hi there, thank you so much for submitting your review. We're so sorry to hear that your recent experience with the Pieper Fleece did not live up to your expectations. Rest assured your feedback has been passed along to our teams so we can do better in the future!

review.reviewBody: Love love love. I had been looking at this for a long time but didn’t purchase because of the price. I finally did and am so happy. It’s so soft, the perfect weight, and flattering too. The length works well for both hiking and wearing with jeans, which is hard to find something flattering and comfortable. Love it.
review.name: Love love love

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the wide/cropped fit of this top and all the pockets that comes with it!! It's so comfy, keeps me so warm and looks great over the Isabel Bib Pants for apres ski situations. Highly recommend!!!
review.name: So cute and so warm!

review.reviewBody: Love fit and oatmeal color. Great fleece. Would purchase in another color
review.name: Love this fleece!

review.reviewBody: I am so glad that I spent the money for this!! I’m in love!! OBSESSED is more like it and now I have to get another one in a different color because I love it so much! The big pocket in the front (2 side zips that are one big front pocket) and the back pocket!!
review.name: OBSESSED!!

review.reviewBody: This fleece is totally worth the price! The color is beautiful. I find it useful when it is chilly indoors and outdoors. It is somehow warm and breathable and so soft! I love the sleeves with a different material on the arms and the styling.
review.name: Beautiful, stylish, warm, useful fleece

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The best casual pullover to wear around everyday. So well made and such a closet staple
review.name: Love this

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I adore this fleece so much!!! Easy to throw on with uggs for a day by the fire…but also works under my ski jacket! I wear it all the time.
I’m usually between a small and medium in most things. at 5’5 130 I have the small and it works perfectly.
review.name: Adore this fleece!!!

name: Pieper Fleece Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.name: Pursuit Quarter Crew High Sock
hasVariant.description: Buy the Swiftwick Pursuit Quarter Crew High Sock online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
...That's a bit dramatic, I know.
A friend of mine who owned a bike shop started carrying these in his store. He gave me a warning that I will never forget, "If you buy these socks, you will no longer want to wear any other brand of sock." I purchased the Pursuit Four in charcoal and went home, tried them on, and I knew my friend was right. That was over 10yrs ago. My sock drawer is now 85% Swiftwicks with the remaining 15% being freebies from events or old hiking socks that I should probably throw out.
These socks wrap your foot with just the right amount of compression. It's like they're giving your feet a hug. There are no annoying seams anywhere and no weird bunching material in places like next to your pinky toe. The Pursuits have a reasonable thickness to them, but because they're merino wool, they're not too hot. In fact, I wear these on rides in the summer heat of central TX and they actually regulate my foot temperature very well. On absolute scorchers, I'll switch over to my Swiftwick Vision or Aspires. But these really are good all year round. They are the perfect sock. There is none better. And I now ask for them for Christmas every year. So, now I pass on the warning. If you get these, you just might not want to wear anything else.
review.name: These socks changed my life

review.reviewBody: I think the other reviewer was confused on the title - this is not a 4-pack of socks, rather 4 refers to the height of the sock. Overall love the fit and feel. Great active socks!
review.name: Great socks

name: Pursuit Quarter Crew High Sock

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a really interesting design. It reminds me of a Japanese style. The sleeves are full and gathered at the wrist and the length is perfect. It’s quilted but is lightweight, not bulky. The inside lining is an unusual bright green, like blades of grass. I can’t say enough about how great this jacket is!
review.name: Beautiful and unusual style

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I adore this jacket so much! It’s so warm but such a good fit and style. It’s like all I’ve wanted
review.name: Loveeeee thissss

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this jacket. It’s warm, lightweight and stylish to wear with jeans or leggings. Fits in my gym bag while working out.
review.name: Warm and stylish Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is very fashion forward and warm. I love the unique details, like the wave pattern stitching and the lining. As a 5’2” curvy person, I also love the cropped length. It hits me just at my hips. I found the relaxed fit to be very generous — I wear a medium on most jackets because I have a large bust and larger arms, but the medium was too large and the wrong proportion for my frame. I ended up going with a small
review.name: So cute but runs very large

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this jacket!! It’s super cute and will keep you warm enough. The fit of the jacket is perfect!
review.name: Amazing!!

review.reviewBody: I LOVE this jacket. The fit is spot on and it's very flattering for a slight puffer jacket. I got the light cream color and it's beautiful. Love the color on the inside.
review.name: Flattering a comfy jacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Exactly what I was looking for! I’m bigger but short, so I hate how long jackets are on me when I would get bigger sizes. This fixes all of those issues! Since it’s cropped it rests right at my hips and I have plenty of room to move around in it. It is a little big on my shoulders but I wouldn’t size down to a M. It’s super comfy and warm, and I love the colors.
review.name: Perfect for bigger short girlies!

review.reviewBody: I have have used the Ozone carry on for years and loved that it is lightweight and spacious. Of course, it has now been redesigned and this new version is terrible. The padded front warps and causes the zipper to curl inward. It is a struggle to open and close the zipper. This has been made worse by the weird plastic coating that is on top of the zipper. I suppose this was to create a water seal but what use it that if it makes the zipper nearly unusable? Just a mess all the way around. Please go back to the old design and get rid of the padded pocket and coated zippers!
review.name: Why did Osprey mess with a good thing?

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I assume that you have received the pack back from me. I liked the design and the light weight, but was afraid that it would not hold up in the long run. It seemed too flimsy to be durable over many years of use.
review.name: I assume that you have

review.reviewBody: I fly about 50-75 times a year; I never check bags. I travel with a roller and a backpack. I've used the Osprey Transporter series (4 wheeled and updated 4 wheeled carry on size) and the Ozone (2 and 4 wheeled carry on size) series; I've used backpacks in each series. These systems have progressively gotten worse, and this roller is rock-bottom bad. First - it tips over. It tipped over in my kitchen repeatedly before I even left my house. This is even worse when a backpack is on top of it. The laptop sleeve is mostly useless space - and this is made worse because the opening at the top of the sleeve is too narrow to reach the bulky empty space at the bottom of the sleeve. There is no good handle at the top of the bag to use to pull the bag out of an overhead compartment on a plane. The bag sits high off the ground, so there is a lot of wasted space beneath the bag that could have been used to increase packing volume. It's almost like the bag was intentionally designed to sabotage its intended purpose. Have you guys (yes Osprey design team, you) ever traveled before? Did anyone test this out (at all)? It is horrible. I started using Osprey backpacks in the mid 90s on some long trail hikes, and those bags were awesome. My recent experiences with the Transporter and Ozone series bags are almost entirely opposite. The Almighty Guarantee isn't so great when it costs money to send bags back because the wheels won't roll (seriously) or the handle breaks in half (true story) ... or now, when a bag cannot even reliably stand upright. This bag is completely useless as a roller, and you don't even have to travel to realize it. Just imagine standing in a crowded airport and having your entire bag fall over onto someone. Or even trying to pack the bag usefully ... or trying to pull it out of an overhead bin when people are waiting impatiently to get off a plane. What a disaster. Osprey, I'm done. Thanks for the ... effort?
review.name: Worse than Worthless

review.reviewBody: I love the look of the bag and it is the first time I have had a 4 wheel bag be so effortless maneuvering in airports and planes. It is easy to grab and once you get the hang of the handle, even though it feels a bit flimsy, it works well. I am, however, on the hunt for the perfect bag, and that would include zippers that glide, and a front pocket with easier access than this bag has. It would be especially wonderful to have an expandable option, even though this fit everything I needed it too.
review.name: I may be returning it, even though it has it great points.

name: Ozone Carry-On 4-Wheel Bag
Ozone Carry-On 4-Wheel Bag

review.reviewBody: I LOVE this paddle so much that the first week I had it I paddled about 14 hours over 3 different days.  The blades are big enough to handle paddling into a current and handy enough for close quarters work in a tupelo swamp.  There was remarkably little fatigue and I only came back in when it was starting to get dark.   215 mm size was perfect for a short (5'4") paddler with a narrow (22") touring kayak.

review.reviewBody:
I had a bike crash , and had a fractured hip, fractured scapula, collapsed lung and broiken ribs . 
I was wearing the this smith helmet , and has no head injuries . 
Best thing i have invested in . 

thank you !!
review.name: saved my life

review.reviewBody:
I checked on several reviews. The first thing I looked for was my own protection and safety, second how it would fit, look and to be comfortable. And third value. 
Passed all my expectations, so I'm happy with my purchase.
I do recommend it.
review.name: Excellent choice, if safety is first...

review.reviewBody: This was a Xmas gift for my daughter-in-law who was very happy with the colour & fit
review.name: This was a Xmas gift

review.reviewBody: The helmet is great. But like anything you wear, the fit is what counts. In my case, the front pushes my safety glasses down and out of my nose. My previous helmet did not have this problem. Again, I do not think it is a problem with the helmet itself, but you may want to consider visiting your Local Bike Shop (LBS) to buy a helmet you can try on with your glasses, etc.
review.name: The helmet is great. But

review.reviewBody: Bought this for gravel riding and love it. Great fit exactly as measured. Snug on my head and chin but not overly tight and can adjust. Very high quality build!
review.name: Bought this for gravel riding

review.reviewBody: The fit is great, but the strap alignment is not very good. The strap keeps loosening during rides. The look is okay but seems the helmet sits pretty high on my head. I don't really like the secondary color and wish it were all black. The quality of the helmet part is excellent though as previously mentioned the strap location and use is average to poor.
review.name: Fit Great - Strap subpar

review.reviewBody: My wife and I each bought one. We both like the way they fit, particularly my wife as she has a smaller head and previous helmets have not been as adjustable.Love the look with the two tone colours
review.name: Smart looking helmet

review.reviewBody: I bought this helmet for some casual road pedaling. It makes me so much more confident and makes me feel so safe. I also love the bright pink color and how light it is. The adjustable knob in the back is extra useful. Plus, it doesn't look clunky and silly like most other helmets. Very low profile and cute.
review.name: Best Helmet

review.reviewBody: Did my research, its a good helmet. Paid this same amount 5 months past for a Lazer Strada Kineticore, (belt adjuster is ok, I prefer dial type). All good, now i'll have a black as well as a white helmet. Honestly though if I had seen this when I bought the Lazer, I would have gone with this.
review.name: ohio_2_erie

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my dad (72) who keeps on the pedals. Had a massive wreck, this helmet is the only thing that saved his life.
review.name: Saved My Dad's Life

name: Persist Mips Helmet

One gripe would be the waistband is a little loose but there's drawstrings that can be tied off! Great shorts for the BC sale price.

description: Buy the Yeti Cycles ARC Turq T3 X01 AXS Mountain Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: ARC Turq T3 X01 AXS Mountain Bike
hasVariant.description: Buy the Yeti Cycles ARC Turq T3 X01 AXS Mountain Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: ARC Turq T3 X01 AXS Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody: I am not sure I am the best to review this bike but I hope this helps someone.  Very experienced cyclist but I wanted a hardtail mountain bike as I ride a particular single track ride 3 to 4 times a week and through the winter here in Colorado.  It is not that technical and basically a training ride.  So the good about the bike is I love the frame and the geometry of the bike.  The components are terrific. The shifting is smooth and precise.  Love the single chainring with the wide range of gears on the free wheel.  Brakes are great and the auto seat adjustment is fantastic.  The bad is I do not like the seat adjustment design as I am used to having my saddle way back on my current bike full suspension 10 year old Yeti.  I am sure it is just how modern bikes are set up but the stem seems to close to me and no way to extend it out.  The bike comes with basically the longest stem you can use with these bars.  For me, as I have an abnormally long torso, this is the main problem with the bike.  I may have to change out the bars and stem to make this perfect for me.  I just can't seem to get comfortable and will have to adjust my riding style to a more upright position.  And you just don't realize these things typically until you ride the bike a lot.  I am also trying to get used to going from a 27.5" wheels to 29" wheels.  These are great to climb with but it just seems a bit high and not as nimble.  I am sure I will adjust.  Overall a great bike needing some changes to fit me perfectly.
review.name: Better and Worse than I expected

name: ARC Turq T3 X01 AXS Mountain Bike

description: Buy the Mammut Eisfeld Advanced SO Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Eisfeld Advanced SO Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Eisfeld Advanced SO Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The pants are great.  The only reason I did not give them a 10 was because the fly zipper is way to short.  I've actually sent Mammut a note about it.  I've noticed this on other snow pants of theirs.  Specifically my ski uniform which is Mammut.
I suggest they put these pants on along with a climbing harness and then try to relieve themselves.
review.name: Great ice climbing pants

review.reviewBody: just got these as I wanted something slimmer below the knee for ice climbing.  lots of great design features, gator clip that tucks away when not being used at top of the list.  definitely a trim fit, especially if you didn't skip leg day.  tried them on with my normal base layer.  my ass looks great...lol  I'm 5'8" 170lbs and ordered a 32
review.name: just got these

review.reviewBody: One of the best alpine/ice climbing pants I've ever tried so far. Fit is perfect. I am 5'6 and weight 165lbs and got a size 32 regular.
review.name: Amazing pants

review.reviewBody: These are an absolute must for extremely cold and demanding adventures! They are thin enough to be able to complete the most technical of approaches, yet warm enough for sub-zero tempos with a windchill of 30 below. Just a base layer under is all I needed while up the Rocky mountains.
review.name: Extremely warm yet feel like normal pants!

review.reviewBody: Durable and breathable. Good fits for ice climbing.
review.name: Durable and flexible pants

review.reviewBody: Used for ice skating &cross country skiing in Alaska. Form-fitting but comfortable. Pares well with thin base-layer.
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: I've had these pants for quite a while now and they've been my go-to for winter activities that don't warrant a hardshell. I've been ice climbing, ski touring, and mountaineering in them primarily in Colorado and Alaska. The features on them are great - they really stay out of the way. My only complaint/caution would be for athletes with thick legs - size up. The waist adjust is super flexible, so you'll be able to take it back out of the waist. I normally wear a 30 and I ended up fitting best in a 34 with the waist adjust cranked all the way down (leaving room for base layers, etc).
review.name: Top choice for heavy-weight softshell

review.reviewBody:
For two weeks, I exclusively wore these pants in the Alaskan backcountry, skiing and climbing. I had an extra pair of softs that I never had to bust out. These were super comfortable, fit true to size even with a baselayer underneath, and we're incredibly quick moisture wicking. You can wallow in waist deep snow for hours and never feel an ounce of moisture. 

Wind protection was notable as well. The crampon pads in the back and the friction pads on the inside ankle were a nice addition. Helped to make sure my pants wouldn't ride up above my boot, or allow any snow in.
review.name: Incredible soft shells

review.reviewBody: Purchased to wear alpine & ice climbing.  The overall design and quality of the Mammut Eisfeld Advanced SO Pants is nothing short of top notch quality.  I have a size 33 waist and ordered size 34 pants, they fit perfectly and the harness compatible waist band makes for a very comfortable fit when wearing a harness.  Although it's a personal preference, I found the color Night nicer and not as dark as it appears online.  Every feature is well thought out and executed.
review.name: Quality at its best.

review.reviewBody:
I would size 1-2 above your size to have enough room for layers. 

Decent design, stretchy. I'm not as flexible as these pants are. 

I like the crampon/ski edge protection on the inside  ankle area.
review.name: Decent Softshell... Shells.

name: Eisfeld Advanced SO Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Ive been wearing Sorels for over 10 years. They are a high quality comfort that's a MUST for me. These slippers have the same quality and comfort as all Sorel slippers, but they're a pain in the butt to put on. You'll always have to bend over and use your fingers as a shoe horn... always. Again, they are extremely well made and comfortable, but once these get old I'll go back to the slip on version.
Very very comfortable. Excellent materials as well.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: This was a replacement slipper. The original pair only lasted 10 years! 👍
review.name: Heavenly Slippers

review.reviewBody: I LOVE THEM. They fit perfectly, they are comfortable..they are big enough to fit my orthotics which is amazing. In fact I have them on now. Good job
review.name: there is even room for my orthotics
